text: Didn't really know what to expect, but I thoroughly enjoyed my experience. The sushi was very good. The wait staff was very attentive and our waitress Candace was amazing. She was a lot of fun and had tons of energy, but in a good way that wasn't annoying. Will definitely be back to check the happy hour next time.

This is  a great addition to Henderson. If you're looking for fresh, healthy Asian-inspired food, check it out. They have everything from salads to Sushi and steak. The restaurant is clean and attractive. The menu isn't too expensive and the staff is friendly.

GEEEEZZZZZZZ... some of these people think they are food critics by the nit-picky tone of their reviews. 

Anyhow, I have eaten here numerous times and the food is always fantastic. I love the Las Vegas Roll, the Lemon Roll, the Shishito Peppers, the Charred Edamame, the Short Rib Ramen, the Stellar Chips... the list goes on and on. 

Also, they have a great selection of beer and wine and an awesome cocktail menu. The Water Dragon is a personal favorite. 

It is the only sushi I actually crave and the atmosphere is friendly, modern and kawaii. 

Go there!

First time to dine in here. Nice place, good ambiance. Started off with drinks, crouching tiger and a friend had geisha girl. Both good, though I favor the crouching tiger. Both have a good kick in it! Tried the Foo's dogs for appetizer, good one! Wish there were more! Forbidden black rice was delish, different but the more you eat of it, the better it gets! I had the pork belly ramen, filling and doesn't leave you too full. I had a bite of my friend's hanger steak, delicious! Careful with the white dipping sauce, if you're not into the spicy things. We both thought some kind of aioli, mayo something.... Too hot, wasabi hot! They were late bringing my friend's meal but compensated by giving us the Funkler for free! This dessert is soooo good, yummy, warm home goodness-good! Nice place, good food, great customer service- what more could you ask for?

Great ambiance !!decor at lucky foo's is quite original to any neighborhood restaurant/bar you'd see off strip. We ordered the charred edamame and Brussels sprouts .. WOW!! That's all I can say.  The sushi came out quick and fresh and the staff was very courteous. To top it all off we had the Funkler for dessert .... ***warning*** if you have anything to do after you eat you probably want to postpone it till the next day because you will want to sleep 

Overall everything was great!
Excellent service great from Miguel and he gave excellent food choices. Thanks Miguel.

The food at Lucky Foos is awesome! Not only is it a great place to hang out with your friends and enjoy a good meal, it's very family and kid friendly offering a kids menu and fun activities. I totally recommend checking out their happy hour, its filled with great deals on food and drinks and the bartenders are warm and welcoming. (If your a big fan of Moscow Mules they make the best ones I've ever had.) I've pretty much tried everything on the Lucky Foos menu and after doing that it's pretty hard just ordering one thing . I go for the Stellar Nachos, which is wonton chips with spicy tuna, avocado crema, sriracha, & pico de gallo, served with smoked chili aioli, they are soo good. All their ramen soups are tasty and they also give you an option of getting dishes vegetarian style . The Lucky Rice is also one of my favs. Oh and you have to try the Funkler for dessert the kids will love that. All in all Lucky Foos is one of the best local spots Vegas has to offer off the strip. From the great ambiance , to the friendly staff it's worth checking out. And don't forget to try out the complimentary hand scrub in the restrooms .

I always go here with family and friends and the place is amazing! I absolutely LOVE the sushi! It's by far the best sushi I have had. The Foo Burger and Funkler and giant fortune cookies are heavenly as well! The kids loved them. My personal favorite cocktail: Water Dragon! Must try! Great prices and service

The rad name and great reviews on Yelp probably increased my expectations.  It was good and has potential.  

We sat at the bar on this visit which had one bartender who was having to make drinks for the entire restaurant.  Although the bartender was super nice, i felt they should have had 2 for dinner service to maintain better service at the bar.  Also, in observing interactions between servers and bartender, the team work lacked.  It seemed the servers were confused often.  I'm sure it's all related to the newness of the place.  

We had the tuna poke, some pork belly ramen, robata grilled beef and onion and some nigiri.  The ramen was pretty tasty and they split it for us.  The robata beef was tender and good and the poke was nice.

The pricing seemed high on the sushi to me, compared to other sushi in the area at around the same quality.

An extended happy hour would be rad.  Why does it have to end at 6?!

The Lemon Roll was the one thing that was a little and I mean very little disappointed, but it is extremely fresh but lacked some flavor. The service was exceptional though and she was attentive. The Fried Rice with Pork Belly was amazing!!!! The Foo Dogs was exception in take. The satay looking thinks with shrimp and jalape√±o bacon was very flavorful. The ambiance and music, primarily 80s music i.e. Pet Shop Boys and Depeche Mode, really nice. I really want to give it a 4.5 because the sushi was fresh but not worth paying a la carte prices when we are in the capital of all you can east sushi, but everything else was sooooo good and the prices very reasonable 6-15 per plate and the dessert was very good we ordered the Giant Fortune Cookie and the Blondie Brownie and it was good so it did deserve 5 stars. I'm in Summerlin, but it is worth the 30-40 minute drive, I'll be coming back soon.

Amazing food and atmosphere! So happy this place opened near my house. I go at least twice a week to get the Vegas Roll or the Forbidden Rice Bowl. Great music and drinks as well. Highly recommend this place!

I like trying new places, I seen pictures of the inside online looked very cool. When I pulled up the sign threw me off it looked like a old casino sign does not do the place justice. The sushi was ok, not many selections but I loved the LEMON ROLL **i might go back for that alone. It was empty on a Saturday night and the hostess failed to sit us in the "21+ area" were there was people and were the ambiance was cool. 

In all I will go back for the lemon roll and cool bar area for drinks!!!

Called and ordered take out at night, only a part of the menu was available: strike one. Showed up for my order the kitchen never recieved my order (in other words the server forgot to ring it in): strike two. Decided new place with kinks so I'll give them a chance and wait. My order comes out, "sorry sir forgot to tell you the springs rolls are 86'd" thanks for letting me know after I still waited for my order that should have been ready: strike three! Three strikes on my first visit and it was only take out. Btw the food is average at best. Just like every other business at this location it will be gone within the year...next.

First off the service was great! Our waitress was an absolute doll! She was from New York, can't remember her name but super friendly and outgoing!!! Second, food and drinks were delicious!! Being an LVAC member and getting 50% off for your first time was AWESOME! Great place and calm atmosphere!!!

I will be short.  

1.  Food was ok.

2.  Service terribly slow.  Took 16 minutes to be cashed out. 

3. Went to the women's restroom and a man came in to clean even after I made myself known.......awkward and creepy. 

4.  Ambiance is great.  Beautiful restaurant.  

5.  Overpriced. Should have went to Jinya. 

Won't be back.
I enjoyed the strawberry infused sake, sushi rolls, ahi nachos are amazing. Tonight enjoying the sake party event.

Came here for a friends birthday with a group of 8 during happy hour a couple of weeks ago. It was an alright experience overall. There were some things I really loved and others that were not so great. 

The good:
-The decor is awesome - they have one wall that we were sitting near that had an incredible painting of animated characters all fitting into one epic scene. Our whole group got a kick out of all the small details in it and spent a lot of time just searching it. It was a fun touch. 
-They use an app called Rockbot that lets guests choose songs to play in the restaurant. It was like a jukebox operated through your phone and our group had so much fun with it. 
-The scallion and chicken skewers were so yummy! We asked for one order of these, then had to ask for a few more because they were so good. 
-In the restrooms, they have this awesome salt scrub that makes your hands feel so soft!

The "eh": 
-Our server was great at first, but seemed like she stopped caring about our table by the end of our dinner. She took our order pretty quickly and the food came out at a decent speed, but many of us had waters that needed refilling throughout the night and had to ask several times for more. Also, after we finished our dessert, it took about 20 minutes for her to finally come by and ask if we wanted the check. Then another 5 minutes for her to bring our check....which she then realized she had made a mistake on so she had to fix that which took about another 10 minutes. By the time we were able to pay, the table was already cleared off and we were all ready to walk out. 
-Something that wasn't a huge deal but just kind of annoying was that during happy hour, they don't let you order off of the regular menu. We were really there specifically for happy hour so this didn't bother us too much but it would've been nice to have the option in case someone in our group was really hungry and wanted something bigger. 

The bad:
-Some of the sushi rolls we tried (specifically the philadelphia and the eel) were very fishy tasting and not fresh at all. In fact, we had to send one of the rolls back because it did not taste like good fish. This was a huge turn-off for the whole place and probably the biggest reason I'm giving them only 3 stars. The rest of the food was good, but fishy tasting sushi is a no-no and just plain gross.
The decor is professionally done.  Stylish and fresh.  The food is wonderful.  Such an amazing menu.  Everything from Sushi to Asian fusion and American.

BAD DINING EXPERIENCE

Thought atmosphere was fine, lots of tv's, but similar to prior restaurant that was there.
Ordered the following:
2 Yellowtail; 1 Big Eye Tuna; 1 Albacore (nigiri's) - Good
Crispy Rice Tuna - Good
Beet Salad - Good
Charred Edamame - Soggy and overcooked
Chicken Lettuce Wraps -  Lettuce was wilted, not crispy; chicken had too many mushrooms and was mushy
Salmon - Delicious and tender
Hot Green Tea - Piping hot served in a nice pitcher 
Moscow Mule - Good

James, our waiter, spilled my Moscow Mule on our table and in my lap. He tried to tell another worker that most of the drink got on him but that was not the case since my jeans and under my chair were soaking wet.

They tried to serve us the Yellowtail, Albacore and Crispy Rice Tuna twice which we rejected and reminded them that we already received the orders.

An owner, Mike, asked us about our dining experience which we relayed the above information to him.

When we received our bill, we were surprised that they did not try to compensate us by reducing our bill (at least by the spilled drink). Also, we realized that they charged us twice for the crispy rice tuna.

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE - We will never be back and will never recommend this place to any of our friends or family!

So this is by far one of the best restaurants in town. Food was delicious it was perfectly cooked the chicken wings were cooked to perfection and the sauce was like heaven. Lemon roll my goodness i can still taste it. Time for the service, from the time that we walked in we were greeted with up most care it's difficult to find a restaurant with 100% quality service. We had the pleasure of meeting the chef and even spoke with him for a few hospitality was tremendously amazing. Hat's off to the entire staff and the quality service in which we were given. I will definitely be coming back.

A much needed addition to a chain infested Henderson! While the flavors still need tweaking, it's presentation is one of a kind. Sushi is delicious and the Asian inspired cuisine tramples neighboring spots easily.

The cocktails are also delectable. Take the menu descriptors to heart because they ring true.

I enjoyed a Resting Panda, a floral Hendricks gin cocktail, and dined on a lemon roll, kimchee laced, fried egg-topped chicken fried rice, and the signature Foo burger. Dessert was a leave the plate empty green tea moochi and a housemade raspberry pur√©e.

While I may not visit for a while, I will definitely be back!

Just have to tell you all about my experience this weekend at Lucky Foo's... My husband and I hosted our annually birthday party here this past weekend with over 60 of our friends/family and it was a complete success! Everyone at Lucky Foo's from Mike Fuller (who helped us get everything set up and running and answered all my questions prior to the party, and who was there to make sure everything went smoothly - awesome dude), to Amy (who's amazing personality helped ease our concerns from start to finish and was just absolutely refreshing to work with), to Candice (our sweet and bubbly head server who literally rocked everyone's world with her on top of it service and kind/refreshing attitude), to the amazing guys behind the bar (who were so much fun and friendly to everyone that ordered a drink), to basically every single staff member who worked that night - the people at Lucky Foo's are the BEST. Now, let's talk about the food - everything is SO yummy! Everyone at the party loved all the rolls we ate, every roll flew off the plate and people RAVED about them!! And the stellar chips and housecut fries are BOMB! I love the food here and can't wait to come back again and try even more of their options. Lucky Foo's was the PERFECT place to host a party. If I could, I would throw a party here every month just because the team made this one of the best birthday's for my hubby and I. I love the atmosphere here and will be telling everyone I know to get their butts in there and try out what they have to offer. The Lucky Foo's team is the example of how restaurants should be run in Las Vegas/Henderson. We will definitely be back again and again, and so will all our guests. Get in here and support a place that treats their guests right from start to finish.  Thank you Lucky Foo's for a wonderful/memorable - all around amazing experience, perfect ten! XOXO!

I visted on monday .Like this place a lot I see a lot of potential .Brand new .Cons  I ordered things on the menu the girl came back and I was told sorry we are not offering that item yet . Couldn't order food for a while  just Sushi  which took forever and a day to make it on our table. Pros It is definatley better than when it was extreme sushi. The food was very tasty.Get the Pork belly !The house  drink I had was very good . The ambiance is top notch . Feels like fine dining without $$$$$ prices . Our servers a short brunette and a tall blonde gave great service. The music was good and not too loud . Overall I will be back in due time to try things when the full menu us offered
Excellent food, great service, love it!  Highly recommend this place.  Sushi was pretty good, ramen was OK but grilled edamame was interesting, very good and unique.  Las Vegas roll was great too.

Great!! The charred edamame and shishito peppers were great for starters. And the short rib steamed buns were out of this world! We had the Las Vegas Roll and warm root veggie salad which were great as well. 

They have great portions here and everything is reasonably priced. It's a very welcome addition and change from the horrible Xtreme Sushi.

This place is fantastic. The happy hour menu made mah tummeh very happeh. Salmon Supreme roll was so good. The tacos were great too, and the staff was super friendly. Sit at the sushi bar and let the sushi chef tell you what you want. He does this for a living.
The prices are a little high food pretty good sushi selection not the greatest. But my group seemed to like it
Love the patio waitstaff and the sushi very fresh and the chef is very creative so if you tired of the same ole sushi menu give foo a try

I thought the food was really good and the service was great. All the employees were super nice. My favorite dish was the shrimp skewers wrapped in jalape√±o bacon. I'll definitely be back in the future.

After seeing some of the reviews about service issues, I was a little skittish about what to expect. I can honestly state that service was great with multiple servers, all very attentive and responsive. We had our menus promptly with a daily special sheet and Sushi Menu. Another server promptly took our drink order which was delivered immediately. Another server came and explained some of the specials and gave us time to contemplate. They returned in about five or six minutes to take our order. Order was served in about 15 to 20 minutes which was served hot and fresh. We started with the Edamame Hummus served with sliced cucumbers which was delicious and pretty filling. Our entrees were the House Special Foo Burger which was easily as good as any $18 burger for $14. I had the BBQ Short Rib special which was delectable-with great flavor and comparable to Wagyu in tenderness and flavor. All of the dipping sauces (ketchup and Ranch) were made on premises and unusual in a positive way. We stayed for the Karaoke and comedy with Jeff Michaels which was quite entertaining and a bargain for the two drink minimum. Other dinner's plates look very attractive and everyone finished their portions which were generous. You won't go wrong here. Closed on Mondays.

I came in with my girlfriend  to grab a bite before catching a movie . We sat at the sushi bar and had a great time. Our server was very sweet and made our experience fun.  I ordered the tai beef salad which was delicious . The chicken and scallion yakitori was delicious and the sushi rocked!!  This place is is my new fave and cant wait to come back this weekend

Heard a lot about this place and have been wanting to try it. Stopped in last week during the early afternoon and was glad we did. It wasn't very busy so we sat out on the patio, to enjoy the nice weather. Asked our hostess if they would let our dog join us, so he wouldn't have to stay in the car. They were so accommodating, they said yes and  even brought extras water for him. We tried a variety of menu items. The sushi choices we picked were The Secret Weapon & The Surf & Turf, both really unique and delicious. We also tried the pork belly yakatori, soo flavorful and tender. Our last item was the cheesey brothless ramen noodles. This was the only dish I was slightly disappointed in, I was hoping for more of the smoked Gouda cheese flavor described, but it was a little overpowered by the herbs mixed in & sprinkled on top. The service was excellent and all the staff super nice. I will definitely go back to try some of the other menu items ( probably the regular ramen soup with pork belly - sounds so yummy ). Definitely a good place to hang out with friends and enjoy a great meal with drinks!

We went to hear the jazz group. I have never heard of this place. What is LUCKY FOO? Beautifully decorated Asian fusion. Good sushi and nice atmosphere. The only low point was the server opened our sake bottle but never served it. Kind of strange but the food and the music was great!!

Went in for a quick afternoon lunch we order the tiger roll and really enjoyed it (enjoyed it to much forgot to take a picture). Then ordered a mountain miso soup and I would say it probably won't cross my mind to order it again!
Overall the experience was good and will probably go back and try a few new things.

My previous review presented how much we (my wife & I) love the food but with service issues the restaurant struggled with.  That's no longer a problem.  If they maintain the service my friends and I received this last visit, this restaurant will be unstoppable.  This place is well priced for the product they provide!

Our server, Amy, was perfect.  She was pleasant, attentive and knowledgeable.  My friend is particular about his drinks and she answered all his questions- no problem.  My Moscow Mule was excellent.  She did proper follow ups with all of us if we wanted refills on our drinks.  We took a bit of time to pick our entrees because we were talking, and that was no problem.  She came back in timely intervals to see if we were ready to order.  She would walk by, check the table, and she could tell if everything was as it should be- so didn't feel the need to interrupt and ask.  There was a young man that kept our water topped off.

Our friends arrived before we did, and they were sensitive to another guest that smelled like the marlboro man himself- the owner gladly accommodated, reseating them in a booth between the bar and the trendy modern Japanese mural wall.  A nice conversation piece for the fans of modern Japanese culture and nerds alike.

Starters: Charred edamame, Ebiyaki, and Stellar Chips.  Easy to share amongst us.  
Cocktails: Moscow Mule, Apple Blossom x2, Sake (on tap).  
Entrees: Cedar Plank Salmon on Forbidden Rice, Sunshine Sushi Roll, Foo Burger, Crispy Rice Delight
Dessert: The Funkler (A nice finish on the meal)

Everything was properly seasoned, delicious, not over the top- per usual!  The food has always been creative and well prepared.  This visit just maintains that reputation with us.  Our friends loved it.  All of our plates left the table clean.  Doesn't matter if it comes from the kitchen or the sushi bar, it's very enjoyable.

The ambiance/environment is trendy, modern Japanese with chill upbeat music playing and martial arts films w/ subtitles playing silently on a few screens.  It just feels good to be in this space.  Very relaxed and comfortable. Balanced lighting.  A nice space to have some great conversation with some friends.

This restaurant use to struggle with service, but have always been on point with environment and food.  They really took the extra steps to move this in the right direction, and I'm pleased for it.  We'll be back again with more friends.

Ambiance/Environment: 5/5
Food: 5/5
Service: 5/5

I really enjoy coming here and eating their food which is full of East meets West flavors. The service is fast and friendly and if you are a lover of Asian culture and cuisine then you'll probably enjoy Lucky Foo's version.

Their Edamame here is a delicious blend of sweet and spicy. They also make a fantastic ramen that has the perfect blends of seasoning and noodles.

My only complaint is that the place is a bit pricey. But there is quality in what they serve, even if the value isn't quite there.

The food is absolultely wonderful.   If you are indecisive or unfamiliar with the various styles of Japanese cuisine, then let the chefs call the shots and tantalize your taste buds with one of the distinctive multi-course dinners or lunch.  My favorite was the poke.  Or if you are in the know, mix and match your own a la carte concoctions of sushi, sashimi, tempura and other delectable delights from the full-service kitchen and bar. Great decor and vibe, great service and friendly staff!

Absolutely LOVED this restaurant! Love dj on Sunday afternoon, enjoyed a bottle of vueve and some sashimi. I'm gluten-free, and not only did they have gf choices...but they modified non-gf menu items so that I could have them too! Super tasty:) I met the owner and he is not only down-to-earth, but a lover of the ocean and kites. Tells me a lot about his ethics and fundamental beliefs. This place is top notch. Try it. You will love it.

This is the type of place that makes you feel like a thousand bucks without actually spending it. The happy hour menu has sushi! I mean what more can you ask for in life? Bartender was awesome! Super trendy spot with good music & such a chill vibe. The original cocktails are a must! You won't regret skipping the beer.
The best service and Sushi chef I've  seen in a long time. The best surf n turf I've ever had

A good friend of mine hosted his birthday party at this venue.  The food was great but the male bartender and the female barback were rude and had a very bad attitude towards my friends and myself.  Other customers that we've met said the same thing.  Those two employees will make it a bad experience for all customers.  Everyone but those two employees were very nice and pleasant.  I'm all about customer service which is why I'm only giving this venue a two star.

4 of us tried out Lucky Foo for the first time last night. Gotta say, the atmosphere is classy & fun. We sat on the patio outside and the service was good. The table wasn't clean when we got there, but the host & hostess went right out and cleaned it up for us. The waitress came along and raves about a few items on the menu to include specialty made cocktails and plates. She wasn't exaggerating, the food was great! We had the charred shashito peppers, the appetizer wonton chips-fantastic! Then we rolled into Lucky Rice-so freaking delicious and sushi rolls- pretty good, but pricy. I still like my all you can eat sushi place, but this was a close second. The price is what earned the 4/5 star review. $14 for a rainbow roll? Come on! I can get just as good all you can eat sushi for $22. Anyways, I would go back for the apps and lucky rice!

Nice place. Good vibe, very locals feel. Menu is interesting and not pricey at all. Opened in November but I never knew it was here. 

Ready to try the food!
Great new Resturant.. The food was the best ever. Still working out the kinks but they recognize it and go above and beyond to give great service. Thanks for the free spicy sushi roll it was the bomb
This restaurant is closed.  Landlord changed the locks on the building and signs posted on every door.  Obviously they weren't paying their rent.
One of my favorite Henderson spots. Way better than the last place that was there, you've gotta try the dumplings, their dumplings are awesome.
Food & decor was amazing. WILL Be Returning AND Updating My Review Once I give it A few more tries.

The decor and everything int he restaurant is really nice and sheik looking. We got the Resting Panda and the Whiskey sour, both of which were very tasting drinks. We started with the Foo Foo plater (just to be able to try a bit of everything). It was pretty good actually, I'd highly recommend it! Our server (i believe her name was Nicky) was super awesome and really nice and helpful. She decided on getting the pork belly ramen and two sushi rolls. The ramen was good, a little salty, but I'd recommend it. Then we received the Spider roll, which was great. Next up was the Crispy roll, which was where the problems arose. We had to wait over 45 minutes for one roll. After about half an hour they finally brought us a different roll to apologize for it taking so long. Apparently they didn't have the crispy rice prepped so that was what was taking so long. I myself am a server, and although the server came over and apologized several times, it probably would have been a good idea to have the manager come and apologize. We finally got it and it was okay, and they ended up comping it, which was nice. I'd give this place one more try...But I most limey wouldn't order the crispy rice roll again.

Nice modern atmosphere and a very cool hangout.  We ended up here too late for the regular menu, but the late night menu had some great choices with quite a bit of variety.

We tried out the Korean wings, spring rolls, spicy miso ramen, and kimchee chicken fried rice.  Experienced some awesome flavors, but in somewhat small servings.  We spent $35 with tip and left satisfied, but not super full.

Our friends had the burrito roll and lasagna roll and enjoyed them both.

Will definitely try again, but looking forward to checking out the regular menu next time!

I ate there this evening with a friend. He had short ribs he said they were awesome, he also had a burger an loved it. He ordered jack and Coke and said it was very watery. I had a dragon roll & shrimp tempura. The sushi was ok nothing special. The shrimp tempura was soggy and blah. The staff is amazing and attentive. My friend had a better experience than I did, so he may be back but I won't :-(

Good food and Great service!!!  Will  be back!

Foo Dog and shishito pepper at good!  Not really busy on a Saturday night, really surprised!  Might become a goto spot new modern Asian food!!

Will try the other menu items the next time!

This place has improved a lot since it have opened. I love the sushi there! The sushi chefs are awesome! Especially Garry and Koong. Very friendly and you can tell their passion is cooking. The best edamame!! The lucky food dog is also on point.

This place is great.  The gentleman that was waiting out table tonight was really cool and very helpful with what's on the menu.  The sushi was bomb had the Inferno roll.  Great roll.  Service was great all around.  Place was clean and wasn't to busy.  You guys rock

This is my favorite place to eat Sushi in town. They are so inventive! The Foo Burger is total Amazeballs. You might ask them not to charbroil if you aren't a fan of that slightly char taste. I know a lot of people are. 
The Nachos are to die for! My mom is a total nacho snob and she loves the twist of the spicy tuna on it. The ramen is good but super messy. 
The best sushi roll I've tried is the Lasagna. Best sushi I've ever had in my life. All their sushi is great, it's fresh and their chefs actually know what they're doing. But the Lasagna is to die for. Total foodgasm. 
Their drinks are great and the staff is super friendly. Justine is a total cool chick. Love her. And our waiter was a total sweetie. I don't remember his name but he had several tats and a rhinestone stud in his face. Totally a great guy and was super patient with my nosy (slightly cheap) mother. 
Total must go!!!

I must say, I've been tickled fancy with my experience at Lucky Foo's. The ambiance and atmosphere is inviting and calming. It's a chic place to dine and wine alone, with a date, and with a group. The service here is excellent. The waiters and waitresses and hostess are on point! They are helpful, respectful, and go above and beyond a an expected acceptable service. Jordan served us and he was amazingly patient - even broke down the menu to a "T" of what we ought to expect in the food selections we inquired about. When our selections (appetizer, entrees, and cocktails) arrived, we were excited. For the record, my dinner guest is EXTREMELY picky and typically remains in the "safe zone" when it comes to food. Tonight, I'm eager to share with all that he loved what he thought he would avoid all together---raw fish. He enjoyed the Stellar Chips as well as I. The rest of our dinner was different, yet delicious and fulfilling. We enjoyed it so much that we barely left anything behind. Lol! Thank you Lucky Foo's for the wonderful experience. Especially the timeliness of the service.... We didn't have to wait long. I'll definitely be back again!
Food is great, atmosphere is cool... does the chef spend any time in the kitchen? We were there for an hour and a half and he talked to women at different tables the entire span of our meal! Haha!

First time eating at this place and OMG the service is impeccable!!! Treated really well as we walked in. I can't believe all the attention we got. It's was great.  Much thanks to Michael and Amy. Everyone was friendly and very helpful. OUTSTANDING SERVICE!! 
Started off ordering almost everything from the happy hour menu - it was all so good, even ordered more items 3x - that good. Ordered the pork belly ramen and spicy miso ramen.   Kids fried rice. I  liked all we ordered so filling. Finished off with the grilled collar salmon. So full. Highly recommended.

I've been dying to try this place since we accidentally walked in on them during their server training prior to opening (maybe we should lock some doors once in a while... lol) so finally when the opportunity arose for a date, Lucky Foo's was what I suggested.

Hrmmmmmm.... I do want to give it a gushing review, but I can't.

First off, not going to lie, the place looks pimp. It looks like an Asian restaurant from a Quentin Tarantino film. If you remember the club from Kill Bill, I got that vibe: traditional but hip at the same time. And the service was killer. Our server was very chatty but not too intrusive, and helped us pick some really great items, including cocktails and drinks. She checked on us frequently, and was really pleasant. So those arenas get high marks from me. Psychic high fives all around.

The food was my main issue, and why this review only gets three stars. Their specialty seems to be the yakitori grill, so I ordered some pork belly skewers with a side of chicken fried rice. While the fried rice is served at an okay-I-guess size (and heads up, they fry an egg on top with runny yolk, not scrambled in like other places), I only got three little skewers, with five chunks of meat. Tasty, to be sure, but I couldn't help but think all the way throughout, "I just paid $10 for fifteen small pork belly nuggets." My wallet wept.

It was an "Oliver Twist" moment, really...
ME: Please, sir, may I have some more?
LUCKY FOO'S: MOOOOOOOOOORE???

Dinner, drinks, and a split dessert (since I was still hungry!) cam to $60 for two people. Gak. Overall, Lucky Foo's has got something good, but it can stand to be better. 2.5 stars is what I would have liked to give it, but it gets the third star for excellent service. At least THAT is on point.

This restaurant is beautiful, the wall mural is really special. 

- Ordered spicy miso noodle, too salty! They also didn't include the egg which was on the menu. I told the waitress and she immediately replaced it.
But I would not order this dish if I were you.

- Scallop special - very good

- 7 piece sashimi - good except for a few tendons from the raw fish and too pricy
Friendly service and really good black rice bowl! Coming back soon for the sushi - looks fresh and delicious.

This place closed a while back, quite suddenly and without much (if any) notice. Too bad, it was a favorite. 

Such a fun place, there is a great energy. The menu is full of little surprises and interesting combinations with Japenese influences. Of course the main items are sushi and they do it right. Also, for those with a sweet tooth, GET THE FUNKLER!

Are here on Valentine's Day for Happy Hour. Chose two specialty cocktails as they make their own simple syrups in house....they were okay and not worth the 12 bucks. The food however was awesome! Shishito peppers and foo dogs to start and both were flavorful. Had the crunch rice roll and it had great texture and taste. Excited to go back and try some if their standards! Overall a great date on a pleasant patio.

This I my third time here. We love this spot. Food is different, original, and delicious. Atmosphere and ambiance are incredible. 

The service has been impeccable so far. Matter of today I went around 6-7pm and though busy I wouldn't have known the difference. Everyone is on point. I also got the honour of observing the owner/manager in action. He is an amazing man, and you can tell he's humble at the core.

I saw him assisting his staff, checking in with each guest. Matter of fact he took the time to sit down and have a mini chat with me and my daughter. 

For those having a hard time with the service, don't give up on them give them another try and I am sure they will redeem themselves.

This has become our favourite local dinner spot. My fianc√© and I absolutely love their creative menu, and find it absolutely delicious. 

We also really like the main bartender. Not that either of us drink, but he has come over and talked to us any time we are having a problem i.e I didn't know that they no longer serve regular menu during the late night"Happy Hour." The French fries aren't on the menu at happy hour and that's all my daughter eats along with a little sushi. He told us he apologises for the misunderstanding and would have the kitchen make her fries! 

Again don't give up on them so easily. Remember it's a mom & pop at the end of the day. Not a big name restaurant. That's what makes this place so incredible. 

- Huge supporter of Mom & Pop restaurants in town!

I was really excited when I saw this place open. I live right across the street so it's exciting to see new restaurants popping up. We went in for their late night happy hour and I have to say I was a bit disappointed by the menu. I got the tofu noodle soup and it was very very bland. I added tons of soy sauce to give it flavor. Sushi rolls weren't bad, the sushi chef that helped us was from LA and super nice. The wait staff service was mediocre.  Our drinks sat empty for long periods of time, no one came to check on us. Over all a very average visit. Food not so great, sushi was good, stick to the sushi bar staff.

Hands down amazing food and service! Fantastic cocktails! The quality of the food is exceptional. Every bite of everything we had was delicious! Can't say enough about how great this place is! Finally a cool hip and comfortable Japanese fusion local place that is open for lunch until late night with 2 happy hours and a patio that is dog friendly. Definitely a rare local home run!! We are regulars now!

I'm currently at their all you can eat sushi happy hour and they get 5 stars for the mere fact that they don't slim down the sushi roll portions or the sashimi pieces for the happy hour special.  As a result, you definitely get your money's worth for some great tasting fish.

Plus, listening to the house music they were playing while getting your grub on is a plus!

Similar to other reviews, we were excited to try out Lucky Foo's, however this was not a good experience at all. 

We had reservations at 5:45 for my husband's birthday dinner (party of two) and showed up at 5:45. First, we waited several minutes for the hostess to seat one party of five, while we stood in the door with no acknowledgment. We were finally seated, where we sat for about 10 minutes without any contact. Next a server from another section said she would get our server. Mind us we are sitting at a middle table where people (staff) are walking around us constantly. Our server approaches the table @ 6:02 and we ask her for the happy hour menu, which she proceeds to tell us happy hour is over. "Well, we have been sitting here 15 minutes"...she leaves the table to do something (we were unclear) and about 4 minutes later another server put down two waters. Another 4 minutes passes, when a man (we assume it is the manager) walks by and asks if he can remove our menus that are sitting to the edge of the table. We both look at him in surprise, "sure, you can take the menus since we have never ordered." He had a look of surprise, "you haven't ordered?" At this time, we have been sitting at the table for about 22 minutes. We look at him (both very unhappy), and tell him yes you can take the menus, because we are leaving. He says, "I'm sorry" and walks away. We make our way to the door and hostess smiles and says have a good night. I stop and ask her, "who is the manager?" she says I'll get him and I say, "Oh is it the guy walking around, checking his cell phone, who watched us get up and walk out? No, we do not need to speak with him!"  And then we left. 

We were there a total of 25 minutes!

Service was awesome. Everyone is super polite, attentive and prompt. I tried the steamed buns, chicken sandwich, scallop yum yum roll and short rib ramen. I was not impressed with any of the food to be honest (except the steamed buns). The presentation is nice but the flavors were not so much. The ramen was super funky to me reminiscent of dirty water. I really wanted to love this place but it wasn't for me. Idk if I would go back given the $13 entree price.
Fun atmosphere. Very friendly staff. The sushi rolls we got were wonderful!  Very good customer service!  We will be returning!  The yum yum scallop roll & shrimp tempura rolls were the best.

Well I can't really give my opinion about the food because we never made it that far. Walking up the place seemed busy, the outside patio was rather full. But inside there were maybe 2 or 3 parties, the rest of the tables were empty. 

We walked in and there were three couples ahead of us, sitting and patiently waiting. No hostess at the hostess station. After about 10 minutes someone raced by and nodded to us and said they'd be a minute. We asked the other people waiting how longed they'd been waiting, which was a good 15 minutes they said. After another five minutes with no hostess, we bailed. Can't understand how you can have so many empty tables and make people wait. There were literally more people waiting to be seated than dining and enjoying themselves lol. We walked down the sidewalk to Greens and Proteins. It was absolutely delicious with GREAT scenery ;) 

Anyway , shame on you Lucky Foo. I brought a friend from out of town touting what a cool new place you were.
Incredible service! Friendly,knowledgable staff, ask Miguel for the info on the Saki sampler. Oh, and black rice bowls and rolls! 50% off first visit for lvac members. I will be back!

Service was good. The server was nice but clearly didn't have much product knowledge. The food was terrible. We tried the miso ramen and to be frank instant packaged noodles taste better. The rolls were mediocre and the dumplings were soggy. I would not recommend this place.

My new favorite place!
Clean and friendly staff. Food is great! Atmosphere is fun, updated and comfortable. Location is convenient. Yum!

So we had the cheese mazemen and it was delicious! The smoked Gouda was a hit!! We had three rolls...the fennel roll was ok. The burrito roll was good with its two sauces and the Hawaiian was great. We also had the Thai beef salad. The meat portions were pathetic. 5 small cubes of meat in an over minty salad. Disappointing. The pork belly skewers were very good. Great flavor on the pork. It was the hubby's favorite. Personally I liked the shrimp and bacon wrapped skewer. Warning...its spicy! But I personally like spicy! The Foo dogs were good. Nothing fancy but tasty. The short rib ramen was good. But the LYCHEE PANNA COTTA was fantastic!!!! The bits of fried coconut on top gave that little added crunch. I will go back for sure.

Having just recently moved to Las Vegas and looking for good local restaurants, I was walking by one day and a guy outside said, " Try it!!  They have the best sushi!" So I decided to give it a try.  It's kind of intimidating moving to a new city and trying new places by yourself. I love the vibe of this place and the staff is so friendly! I've tried many of the specialty rolls... The lemon roll, Hawaiian roll, and the inferno are my favs! Their ahi nachos are a great way to start a meal, and I absolutely love the beef short rib ramen.  They cook the broth for 3 days and you can definitely tell! The depth of flavor is delicious. Last time I was there, Miguel the bartender told me about their happy hour... 3-6 seven days a week with half off sake!  Yessss..... I will be going back there ASAP!!
Had apps and drinks tonight.   Great flavors.  Service was very knowledgeable and helpful. I will go back with the family soon.

Boyfriend took me here to try to find another sushi place I would like just as much as the other 2 establishments I'm pretty loyal to, and I have to admit that it's a good place to eat and hang out. 
Their sushi list isn't as large as other sushi restaurants, which is understandable because that isn't the focus of their menu, but the items are still just as creative and yummy. For example, the Lasagna rolls actually taste like lasagna! Their drinks are just as delicious and hit the spot (classic Espresso Martini in the afternoon)! Another menu that I'd like to bring up is their Happy Hour, which is a good size with variety, so I highly recommend going then. 
Something to try that I wasn't able to get was the Funkler (sp?). 
Almost forgot to mention their customer service... It was excellent. Servers and their helpers are nice, some are sociable than most, and they are attentive. Example: They don't wait to clear your table, which was honestly nice 'cause we were ordering in groups, and I like having a clean table. We had a lady genuinely inquire to my first-time experience there too, which was slightly cool.
try the Pork Belly Ramen and Kimchi Fried Rice with one their awesome specialty coctails!
Great cocktails and the food is delicious!  Service was great as well.  I'd highly recommend swinging in and checking out this spot!

I waited anxiously for Lucky Foo's to open and it is better than I even hoped it would be! The hamachi crudo is amazing, as is the Uni crudo and the completely unique and unexpected tuna poke. Lucky Foo's has become a weekly ritual for my family and me, and my 9yr old son loves the lemon roll, the potato chip-wrapped sausages and the chicken wings. Oh! And the Brussel sprouts! Those are his favorite! The miso soup is delicious and the short rib ramen is ridiculously yummy! Although I'm not really a drinker, their hand-crafted and unique cocktails look tempting. I always settle instead for the best green tea I've ever had - served in a french press, atop a rustic wood platter. If you're an edamame fan - try theirs! Lastly, the service has always been great! I have seen the chef greet guests, on occasion, and the sushi chef always has smile on her face. The servers are friendly and informative and I can't wait until they open for lunch so I can try more things and add more meal times to my weekly ritual! Thanks for opening Lucky Foo's!

Had a Groupon to use. $20 for 2 or more for lunch. Went in at 11am (when they open) since my friend & I both had other plans for the afternoon. Prompt service had throughout the meal. Ordered the Shrimp & Jalape√±o Bacon Skewers (3 for $11 or $12), Brussels Sprouts, & Black Rice ($12 I believe). Brussels Sprouts & Black Rice were great. Shrimp & Jalape√±o Bacon Skewers were under whelming. And I would think for $11 or $12 you would get 4. Checked in on Yelp & got a free Sake Infusion (5-6 ounce) - cucumber melon. It was good. Will have to go in again sometime & try their sushi since my friend is not a sushi person.

I really wanted to love this place but sadly, not the case. I love to support the non-chain restaurants, especially the neighborhood spots close to home. We were promptly seated and greeted by our waitress who took our drink and appetizer order.  Appetizers appeared in a reasonable time but drinks seemed to take quite awhile and showed up after the appetizers had arrived. That was the last time we saw our waitress for the remainder of our dinner, until she showed up with our check, plus a few extra items included we never ordered that were added to the bill.

Positive things, the Foo Dogs were great...not sure I would come back just for these. Decor...pretty cool! We had a variety of items including the Robata and Ramen. Ok, but not great. Again, I really wanted to love this place. Loved the atmosphere and decor, but that would not prompt a return visit. There seemed to be a lot of confusion with food orders as people would show up with food that we never ordered...possibly the reason our check was wrong when our server did finally show up at the end of our meal.

It seems like a bit a training would be helpful as many of the reviews I read after our disappointing meal seem to focus on horrible service. Again...I really wanted to love this place but with the abundance of choices in the area, not sure we will be returning.

First time at this brand new establishment. We had a group of ten and were treated very wonderful. It wasn't very busy which surprised us all that some of the rolls took so long to come out, but as soon we notified our waitress she immediately took care of it. The food was amazing and the staff was just as amazing. The music is dancy (it wasn't too loud but if that bothers you it might not make for a good ambiance experience for you) and they have kung foo on tv (awesome). I would definitely hope for this place to thrive.
Great vibe! Delicious food at good prices. Great for sharing and there is an awesome little chill room filled with pillows in the back. Can't wait to come back!

Lucky Foo's - Unlucky you.  First restaurant that I've been to with a DJ spinning 5 minute songs, she should be helping with service. This place should concentrate on service and add more to the menu to even consider having Restaurant in it's name. The only thing Asian about Foo's are the two semi chefs behind the sushi counter. This looks to be a warm up for the club crowd not a restaurant. Make sure you bring wads of dead presidents, you'll need them. My wife and I drank water, she had sashimi, I had the Hanger Steak. Those were the equivalent of an appetizer so we decided on The Funkler for dessert. From what I read in reviews it was supposed to be pretty good. It was almost stale, maybe a day or two old. Total price with tip $74. I felt ripped off and still hungry! We went on a Saturday night and it was fairly dead & I can see why. I will never go back to this place again. Owners of Lucky Foo's and prospective clients go to Kyara Japanese Tapas off of Jones in Las Vegas and learn about what a Restaurant & Bar with Excellent Service and Food with a Happy Hour is supposed to be like. I am not associated with Kyara's in any way other than being a satisfied customer, every time I go. To be fair it's not all negative they had a martial arts movie playing on their flatscreen but it takes a bit more than playing club tunes (which were too loud) to be called a Restaurant & Bar.  If you think Lucky Foo's is a great restaurant you need to get out a lot more!

Great food, very attentive staff and inviting atmosphere.

Food is reasonably priced and very tasty.

I have been back a few times and HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
The food was alright. Good thing we sat at the bar, because who knows when we would have gotten our food if we didn't order straight from the sushi guys! It wasn't as good as I was hoping.

Based on our experience, we like Lucky Foo's. We have been a couple times now and will be back. It has a cool and sexy vibe. This review is based on our 2/14/16 visit: Our server was very friendly and got everything right and quick. The food was super cute and delicious. The musical ambiance was nice and they have old martial arts movies playing on the monitors.

Whackadoodledoo...

I was in the neighborhood on a Sat in the middle of the day so my friend & I decided to give this place a go since I had it bookmarked for a few months. 

Walking in this place is very nice. Large wooden dolls, inviting outdoor patio that opens right up to the bar area and lots of funky art. Unfortunately nobody was manning the front & it took a few mins for anyone to notice us. Once we were noticed we walked over to a dirty table & stood there while one guy cleaned it off. Wackness #1

Once we sat down I took advantage of my free Yelp check-in offer which was a sake infusion. It was a very light pretty berry color but tasted like rubbing alcohol. Took one sip & didn't come back for more.
Wackness #2

Next we looked over the menu and they offer dinner prices for lunch. Really? A teriyaki salmon bento box for $18 at 1:30pm? 
Wackness #3

Our food ~ this part is extra fun!
I ordered the bento box that came with an over seasoned piece of salmon. Salad with no dressing (I hate getting served just plain lettuce), Greek white rice (yep, this was weird & didn't work), a Cali roll that tasted like it came from the grocery store and guess what? No teriyaki sauce. Even though I ordered teriyaki salmon this place doesn't carry teriyaki sauce. Are you f$@%g kidding me? So they brought me over another sauce that had zero sweetness. My friends ramen looked beautiful but was very salty. My miso tasted like warm water. 
Wackness #4

After paying $40 we are officially not into this place. I've had better ramen & bento boxes for half the price. Just a piece of advice to the person that runs this place - Please get some teriyaki sauce, especially for items that carry it in the title of the dish. Please stop serving Greek rice and most importantly come up with some lunch specials. Your place is beautiful but based on just that I wouldn't be back.

Two words, Happy Hour!!! Very nice and trendy restaurant... Staff was very nice and welcoming... Happy hour is from 3pm to 6pm, totally worth it!! Great happy hr menu and regular menu items as well...  If you're around the area I definitely recommend you give this place a try and see for yourself....

Short & sweet: Service was great, sushi rolls were bland, pricing is off.

Came with a friend for their happy hour/AYCE special. When we got in we were seated quickly and the service was great. 2 waitresses greeted us to take our order, and 2 gentlemen made sure our water glasses were NEVER empty. That is THE reason Im going with 3 stars. The service was excellent.

Onto the food... The sushi menu was decent. Maybe roughly 30 rolls? For all you can eat, however, you can pick from about 7 special rolls and 7 classic rolls, some of those only being available 1 per person. 
We ordered a pair of infernos and runnin' rebel rolls. Both of which were fairly bland, short of the cream cheese on the rebel roll. My buddy ordered The Secret Weapon and thought it was alright, as well as a crispy rice delight. I got the spicy salmon and some yellowtail nigiri. The yellowtail tasted a bit off, but what can I really ask for at AYCE?

The kicker here was the price. The happy hour/AYCE price, with the skimpy menu, is $27.95. $30 & change after tax. Comparing this to similar places (but with tastier rolls), the dinner AYCE price should be closer to $22, maybe $25 max. Lunch should be around $19, but I dont think they offer AYCE lunch.

If the AYCE is a sample of the rest of their sushi dishes, I definitely wouldn't come back here to eat.

$7 Spicy Miso Ramen?* I'm in!
HH menu is pretty dang good, food items for $7 each with good variety, plus beverages for $5. Quantity and quality are both pretty good for the price, save for the sushi rolls which are fairly basic- that price for a California roll isn't really a deal to me.

FOO FOO PLATTER gives you a sample of most of the apps for $15.
WINGS: meh, fall-off-the-bone tender slash overcooked without any flavor.
DUMPLINGS: opt for steamed over fried, vegetarian over pork options available, the dipping sauce is delicious, heavy on the chili oil
SPRING ROLLS: crispy, possibly fresh out of a freezer box, tasty dipping sauce
WON TON CHIPS: not my thing but they did eventually grow on me, very light seasoning is complemented by the green onion dip intended for the wings
FOO DOGS:  skewered kurobuta sausage wrapped in a potato chip is actually pretty dang good! Bummed that I didn't receive either of the dipping sauces mentioned in menu description, though.

But the ramen. That's what I came here for, and that's what I was underwhelmed by. The spicy miso broth was all spice, no miso, very one-note devoid of the richness signature to a great ramen broth. Charred scallion leant an unpleasant burned flavor to the dish, but I did enjoy the mushrooms. The egg was cooked perfectly but the noodles were overdone? Not sure how this was managed.
*Additionally, a double-take at the menu when I left revealed that I was charged full price for the mostly-untouched bowl rather than the HH price. Grrr!

Service was hit or miss. Karen, the sushi chef, was a delight and gave me a sample of their Hamachi with ponzu, jalapeno, and sriarcha- fresh and delicious! Blonde female server was peppy and prompt. But the hostess was out of it, didn't acknowledge me for several minutes and then brought me the wrong menu. 

NOTE: Menus on website are outdated and do not include pricing.

I'm a little embarrassed that Audi would have their A4 launch party here. To give them the benefit of the doubt, it is a launch party so it is expected that the restaurant would be busier than normal.

We waited 45 minutes for 2 rolls and a side, and received no refills on our waters. 

They claimed they comped us, but they just comped a roll they charged me for and didn't I receive. 

Short staffed the night of a launched party, I'm displeased.

Excited to finally check out this great local spot. First impression; wonderfully chill vibe, cool decor and our waitress was excellent! The Moscow Mule is a great traditional cocktail to start and the water dragon has a unique peppery kick. The food is unique Asian "fusion" and is meant to be shared, so many of the items come out as 2 or 4 pieces. The short rib steamed buns were phenomenal. Crispy spring rolls were delicious. The portions are a bit on the small side, but it's a great way to try many different items. For dessert we tried the giant fortune cookie and chocolate snowball. One word: delicious. Overall the food was great, service was so friendly, can't wait to come back. Btw they have happy hour...looking forward to that too!

To be honest... i guess i was expecting just a little more.  The stellar nachos were by far my FAV item of the night. the ramen i will NEVER order again... ill stick to Monta Chaya up the street for my ramen fix.  The ramen here was just way too earthy for our liking.  it was called spicy ramen but with NO spice whatsoever.  The lucky fried rice was good.... but like i said... the stellar nachos stole the show!
I love the ambiance, service was great, and the sushi rolls were amazing! But you really have to try the Funkler for dessert!

I love this place! Great sushi! And they have other stuff too if sushi isn't your thing! They have really great service and they're always so nice! And the inside looks sweet.  I highly recommend this place! Must try!!!

The dumplings were good. The service was sketchy. The featured item in the menu was boxed in the middle of the menu was mushrooms cooked on a 1000f oven. We sent them back. They were not good and not hot. They had a sauce on the outside of them that tasted like cold sweet BBQ sauce. The sushi rolls were tastee but we were given the happy hour menu after happy hour. They didn't have the shrimp and bacon skewer. They didn't have the Anchor Brown beer I ordered. We ordered desert and the guy brought out the snowball and left the serving tray. With all this, as we were leaving and stopped by the bar and I asked what was in the big clear Vats with cantaloupe floating in them. The bar tender's responded "Cocaine" I was like what??? The other bartender quickly ran up and explained it was infused saki. Probably won't go back for a while. Will let them shake out the wrinkles.

So thankful that this place renovated and went under new ownership. This new spot has been nothing short of spectacular. The Environment, ambiance, service has been exceptional and can't say one thing negative about it. Food was phenomenal. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED**** kimchee friend rice, fennel roll, and lemon roll. Especially the lemon roll. WOW. If you know me you know I know food and this place will get me back here... A lot.

Everything was good. Maybe a little overpriced, but no real complaints. 

Drinks were great, and unique. I'll be back again for sure, lots of stuff to try on the menu.

Went to the Yelp event this evening and ordered a few appetizers and their Forbidden Rice. First of all, the hostess happily walked me to where my husband was waiting. We got introduced to Michael, the owner who showed us around and proudly explained to us a little about how his restaurant came to fruition and our waitress was so sweet and highlighted her faves as well as other very popular items on their menu. We decided on the charred edamame which was the most flavorful edamame I have tasted. It had of course a charred flavor profile with a sweet teriyaki-ish sauce and a sprinkling of toasted sesame seed. We also got the Shishito peppers which had a drizzling of a mildly sweet sauce and shredded pickled ginger accompanied by a mayo based sauce and last but not least the Forbidden Rice. Explaining this dish will not do it justice, the menu didn't do it justice. you just have to try it once and you're hooked! I'm really bummed because now I HAVE to order this whenever I go there and I really wanted to try other menu items...sigh

Michael let's me host my monthly documentary event here called PopDocs in a private room. Like PopDocs on Facebook! The event is open to the public and Lucky Foo's is accommodating. We always order food during the documentary and grub away. I need to come here to check out their brunch too. If you dot live in Henderson, this place is still worth the drive to check out.

I'm not sure why I don't eat here every week.  The shishito peppers are to die for.  I tried the forbidden rice and it was unbelievable.  So many great flavors and very unique.  Too full for dessert.  My husband loved his short rib ramen and my margarita was solid. Great place!! Also Heather our server was very sweet.

Stopped in for lunch today with my girl. As soon as I walked in I saw a d j booth , no phat beats and mad bass at lunch but I hear Thursday nights it's bumpin. We were sat with Jennifer and I could go on for hours so I will just say she was "the sweetest thing", so nice. I had never been in before so I was looking about and ran into Julia who took me thru the whole place and showed me the artwork, bar, the rooms, the Kimmi dolls, very unique. Thank you Julia. We ordered miso soup, pork belly and brussel sprouts like I have never had before, outstanding. Great staff, cool spot, will hit it up again.

I have to say for Jap Fusion joint I totes dig it!!! 

I have been wanting to come try Lucky Foo's for awhile but with a 1 and a half year old who can't stay still and a brand new newborn who hasn't gotten her shots yet makes it for a hard expedition. But anyhow we finally made it here.

The happy hour is awesome because it's everyday and it's from 3pm-6pm. So weather you are off during the week or weekends you can take advantage of their deals. Lucky Foo's has lots of tapas type dishes with mini bites.

My wife and 2 kids came here on a Friday night well more like (5:00pm) and it was not busy at all but it took a while (10 or so minutes) for anyone to acknowledge that we were there. Which kind of suck because when you got young kids and want to do anything you need to make it snappy wam bam thank you bam kind of deal. That the reason for the none full five star rating. Others then that everything else was awesome except for a few minor clothes here and there. Also but when someone did finally greeted us she was very nice and super friendly to my girls....well actually the whole staff was pretty much like that. 

The resturant decor is awesome we've all seen pix of it. They offer indoor and outdoor dining. They even have this cool room towards the back with traditional jap seating style area, I'm not sure if it's for dining or what but the lighting in there is cool and it can be semi closed off. 

Anyhow back to the food. So the happy hour prices are ok and they've picked a handful of populars to put on the menu and the drink deals are good. We order the Charred Shishito peppers (my new favorite thing in the world), the Ebiyaki , Foo dogs (so good), the Robata Grilled Pork Belly (I love pork belly) and the Crispy fire cracker rice Roll (I think that's what's it's called) and an ice cold Asahi and an Old Fashion to go with the meal. 

Everything was mostly off of the HH menu for about $6-$8 and they were all delicious and small portioned. Except for the Ebiyaki. I've never had that before so I don't know what to compare it to but it sounded and looked better then it tasted. I thought it was going to be a lot more crispier but it wasn't and it had a weird mushy filling that wasn't really good so skip that. But the peppers was dresses nicely with a side of awesome sauce. No really the aioli they give with those was amazing. The 3 mini foo dogs wrapped in potato chips was so juicy and tasty and the chip was crispy and thin; awesome. The pork belly was pork belly just really fatty and good. The Crispy firecracker roll was good but lacked in spicy tuna like they promised and the thin jalape√±o was so thin it almost disappeared. As for the rice I mean I Iove crispy just as much as the next guy but the roll was pretty much all crispy rice. But for what it was it was very good. 

Needless to say before we can even order the rest of our meal and drinks the kids were going crazy so we had to pack up and leave with what we had left or haven't eaten. My wife got here beer at the beginning of the service but I never got my Old Fashion (their signature drink) so I'm going have to try it next time to give it a proper review. 

Besides all that I was glad we were able to squeeze a little bit out of our attempt of a night out with 2 little ones. Now we got to come back and try out the other stuff we wanted to eat and drink, and we definitely will be back.
The bartender Miguel was cool helpful on the menu and makes a smooth Manhattan!! Good vibe in here too!

Tried this place once and will not come back. We came in after lunch hour so the place was not busy at all, we were seated and sat there for over 5 minutes before someone came to take our drink orders. Throughout the meal, they were having training or some kind of meeting in a room next to our table and they were so loud the entire time, we could hear them talking and discussing, it was not a big deal but just really distracting when we were trying to have our own conversation. 

The food sounded better on the menu than it tasted, the only thing that stood out to us was the grilled pork belly. The rest of the food was really bland and not impressive at all. We also ordered a fish fillet that comes with the skin still on the fish, I am not disgusted by fish skin at all, in fact I usually don't mind eating the fish skin... but this fish fillet still had lots and lots of scale on it. It was so disgusting, the waitress was not even around for us to ask for a different piece. Needless to say we did not finish the fish, we reluctantly ate the rest of the food and left. 

They also advertised happy hour food and drink menu but the happy hour menu did not offer many options at all. Had so much expectation for this place because I heard good things about this place, but my experience was terrible.

Our first time here and we'll definitely be back! Happened to hear about them through a friend and it sounds like they recently opened. Service was excellent, I also liked the ambience and decor. We were here on a Sunday night and they weren't very busy.

We ordered a lot, so our bill was high for two people w/out alcohol ($90) but we like to try a bunch of things.

Highlights:
Lemon roll - California roll with yellowtail, salmon and thinly sliced lemon on top (fresh tasting, really good, our favorite dish so far)

Foo Dogs - mini kurobota sausages wrapped in potato and deep fried (also very good, could've eaten 10 of them, bummer it's only 3 per order)

Short rib ramen - short rib was tender, broth was excellent, texture of the noodles was more like soba, but I still enjoyed it 

Short rib steamed buns - again, short rib was tender, great flavor, bun was steamed perfectly, only complaint was too much parsley

Pork belly skewers - good flavor but very fatty, even less meat than what you normally find in pork belly

Chicken fried rice - loved the crispy bacon on top, loved the Kim chee, but there was a sweet flavor that I didn't like (personal preference)

Chicken wings - will pass on these next time, nothing really special about them and they're really large (for wings) and came out piping hot so really hard to eat/handle

I have been coming to enjoy the magical deliciousness for a little over a year now. Let's first review the ambiance, it is very chill with great music and beautifully decorative walls by different artists. My favorite is the "wall of doll's" miniature geisha doll display that I always want to take when I walk by because they are so cute.!! Everyone is quick to make you feel welcome. Although I have had service with many servers Amy is Amazing.!! She is friendly & checks in to your every need. She offered her expertise on the style of drinks to try and makes suggestions to the menu.She delivers A++ service to her customers and makes you feel very welcome. Let's talk "FOO'D" ;) My new obsession is the Lasagna Roll, second the Lemon Roll. The freshness of the lemon zest Lemon roll leaves your tongue wanting more.!!! A must have when you come over.! I love the ebiyaki- they are scrumptious (deep fried shrimp battered balls with red ginger, creamy kosho aoli). I get them almost every visit. They offer many beer and wine, sake and unique cocktails to choose from. I suggest the brussels and shisito peppers to have as a yummy appetizer. Although I did not have it this time, if you love chocolate then you must try The Funkler.... Chocolate chip blondie with vanilla bean ice cream and chocolate sauce drizzle. Wow.! It is my FAVE.!!! They also have the huge fortune cookie dessert you should try. I have been in love with the food here for the past year and have brought many friends and family to experience Lucky Foo's. It is in my top 5 local hot spot as a Vegas native. My next time is Taco Tuesday and Sunday Brunch.

Yay! They finally put a great restaurant in this location! I was a customer twice back in the Extreme Sushi days and that was enough to last me a lifetime. Lucky Foo's is such an upgrade and an awesome new addition to this center. I really love what they did with the place. So much better than before! If you haven't been yet, you should check it out. 

Already they were off to a great start with the major improvement in the atmosphere. Then we ordered and WOW, their menu blew me away too. So many interesting dishes and drinks to choose from. I can't wait to go back and try more! Everything we ordered was great but a few favorites were the Pork Belly Yakitori and the Charred Edamame. That Pork Belly just melts in your mouth. You must try that! I also loved the fact that they had so many choices for Sake. I ordered the House Infused Apple Sake and it was so good that I ordered another. Also worth mentioning... the Caterpillar Roll and Philadelphia Roll but I prefer to recommend things that are unique because you can order these items at any sushi bar. I'll try more of their menu and update this review after I have a few more visits under my belt but for now I was way impressed. 
They even have this cool app called Rockbot that you can download to choose what music they play. I had fun with that. 

As an extra bonus, there was a familiar face there. Much to my pleasant surprise I was able to locate a chef that I had lost track of named Koong. She's a chick whose sushi game is on point! Now I already know this restaurant knows what's up since they hired her to work here. No wonder I loved my food!

In closing, I will definitely be back since now it's my mission to become the duchess of Lucky Foo's by getting the most checkins. Excited about my next visit! It's nice to have that feeling after visiting a restaurant for the first time. I need to explore more of their decor since I'm studying interior design. The visual stimulus here was off the chart! I was invited to check out the other rooms but we didn't have time this visit. I will definitely be back for that, plus to hang out more because I really love this place.

Wow! Place is beautiful and has an open air sushi bar as part of the restaurant and a large patio with very comfortable seating. Server was very friendly and was able to describe many dishes without hesitation. Ordered Sushi and a Sakai and endomami. Everything was delicious! I recommend Lucky Foo's
Beyond awesome service, chefs, food and atmosphere!  Great house infused sake free with yelp check in!  Steak and onion  plus maitake mushroom robata grill are spicy tuna tempura rolls impressive.

The restaurant doesn't look very unique from the outside and you may question if it's just another short term solution for the space once taken my restaurants that come and go, but the food experience inside is pretty amazing. I hope they keep strong momentum and are here to stay in our neighborhood. 

There are fun wooden dolls that provide a unique look and feel you would expect if this place was in a casino. The host person and staff were friendly and professional. Menu navigation was easy for dinner and shared plates with a small group is the way to go. 

Start off with their apps and try the Lucky Rice. While the prices seem gourmet level, the quality and presentation definitely support it. We also had the Thai beef salad, short rib steamed buns (delicious!), foo dogs, yakitori, and a number of sushi rolls. Many of the dishes are a bit spicy, with various usage of chili and jalape√±os.

Cocktails were solid - offering classics and interesting specialties that are uniquely crafted for anyone's tastes. 

Definitely visiting again.

Food, drinks and service are amazing!!!! Lucky foos is a hidden gem!! Crispy rice delight and lucky rice are worth the drive if you live on the other side of town.  I'm so glad it's right around the corner from my house and I plan to make a regular hang out.
Great pork fried rice! great layout good for quiet and loud parties.

Delicious and convenient for Henderson peeps!! The sushi is delicious, the Lemon Roll has a great light and fresh flavor.  Also try the Secret Weapon Roll....trust me on this one! Get the 20 piece sashimi plate ...can't go wrong on this one. Desert? Definitely the Funkler. Put this place in your list, great atmosphere too love it.

Amazing food, unbelievable service.  Chef came out and greeted us and shared his culinary journey...wow so incredibly talented with a gift that totally shows in his love for the art.  The menu is so unique.  We sat at the sushi bar and were equally impressed with Koong the female suhsi chef...she is amazing and talented! Highly recommend this place for a quick lunch, business meeting, date night...overall a great place to dine.  The forbidden bowl is a MUST try....wow!!!!

I'm torn about this place. I wanted to try it for so long. So I joined a large girl's dinner group. They were amazing at accommodating a group of our size. Set us up in a small banquet room and had plenty of servers ready. Our server was really nice but a few of our orders were wrong (drinks and food runner). Not sure who went wrong, but our server gladly fixed it. When ordering, they were out of a few items, which was a bummer. Once we got our food, it was very flavorful; however, the bacon wrapped skewers were very undercooked. My friend pushed them aside, the server noticed and replaced them. I then received my pork belly steam buns, also undercooked. I ate them anyways, but didn't feel so hot the next day. Overall, the place has fun drink items and flavorful food but the inconsistencies were a major turn off.

Came in during happy hour. Ordered the hamachi collar---they didn't have it, got the salmon collar instead, it wasn't bad, salad that comes with was pretty good. Ordered the forbidden rice dish, they brought it out unfinished... It was just the rice.... Asked about it, they brought it back out a bit later finished... It was good, but I don't think it would bring me back. I also ordered an inferno roll to go, not impressed.

At first I was a little hesitant to try this place because of a few negative reviews.  That and the previous two restaurants here always seemed to struggle with customer service.  So naturally I thought oh here we go again...  I couldn't be anymore wrong.

The service was top notch.  Our food came out promptly and the servers checked up on us frequently but not over the top.  Needless to say our drinks never went empty. 

We started with the wings which came out pretty quickly. Had a nice tangy bbq kick to it. 

My wife had the Foo Burger.  She said it reminded her of Bachi burger but slightly better which speaks volumes because it's one of our favorite spots. 

I'm not much of ramen fan but I'm sold on anything with Pork Belly so  figured I'd give the Pork Belly ramen a try.  I was pleasantly surprised and will look forward trying the other noodle dishes. 

I think the service alone is good enough for us to come back and from what I understand they're also known for their sushi so will have to come back and give that a try.
Crazy weird hotdog with a potato chip crust, liked the lasagna roll, fun drinks, fun staff. GIANT fortune cookies.

I celebrated my 21st birthday dinner here at Lucky Foo's and it was amazing! the food was excellent and they had some really fun cocktails. The staff was also really nice and answered all of our questions and the owner is a super awesome and friendly guy!  My friends, family, and I all  had an amazing time and the next time we are in Vegas we will definitely be coming back!

I seriously don't understand how this place isn't slammed every time I go it. THIS IS THE BEST RESTAURANT.  Not only is the food AMAZING, the staff is always so friendly! My girlfriend and I were talking about how WE ALWAYS make friends when we come have dinner. It's just such a relaxed and fun environment.

This is a great local spot in a central neighborhood! My husband and I were so excited that this spot was going to be open next to our gym and all of our shopping needs.  It has an extremely fun and vibrant atmosphere for evening dining and drinks! It also had a multitude of tasty and healthy options for eating which is always a plus for me!  I can't wait to go back and try more items from the menu!

Try the moscow mule and the happy hour appetizer menu - you can't go wrong
Fun atmosphere, clean restaurant, and good food. They offer a variety of specialty rolls, which were all delicious.

I highly recommend Lucky Foos. This is definitely a new hotspot on my list. The food was fantastic!  It was difficult to make a decision because everything on the menu sounded so good. My family and I sampled several items and everything was amazing. The food was very fresh and the service was outstanding. I loved the decor and atmosphere. This place would be a perfect setting for a party or holiday gathering with a DJ booth onsite. I suggest that you try the Moscow Mule...you won't be disappointed.

Lucky Foo for happy hour today! 1st time here & it's fantastic. The staff is super friendly. The bartender Miguel recommended the Ebiyaki: 5 Japanese shrimp battered balls, deep fried with red ginger, creamy Kisho aioli & bonita flakes. The sushi chef Gabe made me the Lasagna roll: crab salad, avocado with yum yum sauce, cream cheese, eel, sriracha, micro greens & fried shallot. Wow, both are taste explosions. All around phenomenal! Will be back to try much more!!
Thee best hands down best Japanese Lasagna in town! Nice atmosphere, great service!  I'll be back for sure!
The food is amazing with a great vibe!  Highly recommend the Steamed Buns and the Salmon Supreme Roll.
