I had lunch there today. Service was good. The waitress kept coming back to refill my glass. I ordered the Lucky rice. Or whatever that's called. It was good but I wish that you could ask for the spiciness to be a little cooler. We also ordered the steamed buns and they were really good. Although they were good the price was ludicrous. I mean like $10 something for 2 buns. Like really. If I ordered two of those that would be like a whole meal at Panda. The prices were what made me not wanna go back. The food was good but the prices suck.
Great tasty creations! Nothing too over the top and the portions are just right. Nice ambiance!
Great atmosphere and greater food!   Much needed off-strip sophisticated dining by Eastern & 215.

Mouth succulency, food porn, GASMIC sensations times a GodZillion fold.
Have you ever eaten food that simply makes you feel alive? Food that makes you tingle all over? Food that gives new meaning to why we eat to begin with?
Why eat food that has no meaning when you can eat food that gives meaning to why you eat food in the first place? 
Yes, this place is that place.

Atmosphere: We went to Lucky Foo's on a Saturday night and it was pleasantly quiet.  We sat at a booth that was situated between the sushi bar and the main dining area.  It was dark, intimate, but trendy and comfortable.

Food - We got six things: 1) Foo dogs - good bite for someone that may not be too adventurous. 2) Emiyaki - yummy egg-roll hush puppy. 3) Shrimp with Jalape√±o Bacon Robata - Good flavor but hard to get it off the skewer. 4) Pork Belly - was okay as it was fatty and not sauce or glaze on it.  5) Jalape√±o Yellowtail - So good!!!!!! Must try!!!!!!! 6) Lucky Rice - It is a kimchi fried rice and was sooooooooo delicious!!!! Good thing about this place is that food comes out when it is ready, the way we like it!

Drinks: Hibiscus Martini - for someone that like things sweet. Moscow Mule - Love that it is served in a copper cup and was very refreshing.

Service: Sandy (our waitress) was wonderful!  She was attentive and got out drink orders quickly. We ensured we had water at all times and drinks replenished.  We asked her about Brunch and she was great at explaining the menu. 

This is a perfect place for us to become a local.

New place in a convenient location at Eastern and 215. Food was good, service was good, and there were some new items on the menu I've never seen before. It seemed to have a hip, yuppie feel in the atmosphere. I'll be going back again.

Place is not even worth walking in.  Prepackaged garbage, no flavor, wait staff knows nothing, the place looks nice but that's really about it. Thank god we took advantage of the LVAC discount because I would have been so pissed to pay full price for this fake food. The ramen was more than likely the worst I have ever had. Never going back! The server sucked from the beginning we walks in till the end, she knew nothing about the menu and could not even recommend what order lol! She sucked! Omg I can't believe this place gets any good reviews, it's a joke. Don't waste your time on this place. You must listen to this review. Stay away!!

Mediocrity at its best. 

Weird, spotty service. The staff seems snooty already...as if they're already a successful restaurant. 

Far from it...

We stood at the front entrance for a few minutes with no one to greet us before taking matters into our own hands. We walked over to the left side of the restaurant where we saw a group of about five people conversing. They finally took notice and sat us. They continued conversing for the next five minutes until one of them came over to serve us. Again...weird.

We ordered some happy hour items: wings, tacos, sushi rolls. Nothing had pizazz. Nothing was impressive...very boring and blah. 

That's enough out of me. They didn't want to give me the time of day, so I won't either with a long winded review. Just not impressed. 

Should've gone to sushi-mon.

1 star because you can't give less... The food was less than ok, the prices were too expensive. The service was AWFUL! They forgot some of our order for over 30 minutes, still charged us for everything. We constantly had to ask for refills on our beverages and they weren't even busy. We will not be back.

The atmosphere and food were both incredible. The menu was put together quite well with a variety of original styles that appeal to different appetites. 

Favorite sushi choice was the burrito. I have never tasted a sushi roll quite like it. We all ordered a couple dishes each and shared. Didn't find one dish that I didn't care for. The owner Michael came over and spoke with us for a while. He explained the menu and was very informative. The service was excellent. Definitely deserved all 5 stars!
We really enjoyed our first trip here. The service from the front door to our server Jennifer was amazing. Will repeat for sure.

**Closed it's doors! Can't imagine why!**

Who runs out of sushi rice and stays open? This place! Who lets you order a bottle of wine before telling you they're not serving sushi anymore because they ran out of rice? This place! This is second time this has occurred here! And they still charged us for the wine! I don't know if they now have a new manager but I'm done and never coming back! Paid $28 for a $10 bottle of wine that should have been comped because their poor managerial skills. Next time, tell people coming in the door you're out of sushi rice! Definitely not the place I reviewed last year when they first opened!

I checked this place out last week and I was highly impressed.
The food was delicious and the recommendation by owner Michael Fuller were right on! My favorite dish was the kale salad and the kimchi chicken fried rice! Oh boy they were off the charts. In general everything we had was exquisite.
I was also very impressed with the chef who came out to check on the tables. He noticed that my friend had the flu and immediately sent her (us) some hot tea.  I'm excited to see this new restaurant succeed! 

Overall I Highly recommend Lucky Foo's !

The food is way over priced for what it was. I did not like the Lucky Rice at all. I also asked the server if it was spicy and she said only the Kim chee is so I ordered it without Kim chee. However, there was still something really spicy in it.

My boyfriend got the tuna poke salad and that was really good. I should have gotten that instead!

This place is awesome!
Great Sushi, great service, and a full bar.
So nice to see a Sushi place so close to home.. Well done!
I discovered Lucky Foo's about 2 months ago and I've been in 4 times.. Very consistent with everything.
Finally a great sushi place near Henderson! Whatever you do, don't leave this place without trying the secret weapon role and the funkler for dessert!!!  Sashimi is delish.
This place is one of our new favorite spots. Everyone is always friendly and the food is always good. Great atmosphere overall.

I came for the ramen and stayed for the, "Funkler". 

I had to visit Lucky Foo's twice, back to back, in order to verify my five star review. This place is firing on all cylinders, the food is fresh, imaginative, and completely over the top. It's like a shroomed-out unicorn, who moonlights as a chef, is in the back spewing out rainbow infused foodie ideas. Not weird at all. 

During my visit I ordered a little bit of everything. Spicy Miso Ramen with Short Rib, Forbidden Black Rice, Chicken Teriyaki skewers, Charred Shishito Peppers, and the Funkler. 

First off, no I haven't exploded, but I would have kept eating if I didn't have other things to do, like fall into a food coma. I started off with the charred shishto peppers. These were a simple yet elegant way to start the cavalcade of food coming my way. Charred to perfection, with small bite of heat. They were paired with a creamy kosho sauce sort of like a creamy hummus - not the flavor, but the texture. Amazing pairing, awesome way to fire up the palate. 

The Miso Ramen with Short Ribs was swimming in one of the best ramen broths I've had in a while. It was so rich and flavorful that it should be served in one of those children's bowls with a straw attached. The short ribs were so tender that they almost melted when pinched between my wooden eating utensils. The sexy mix of texture in the ramen along with the eggs, nori, charred greens, and bamboo shoots is something that only exists on TV... Padma, I'm looking at you.

The Robata Skewers are simple, but delicious. Slow cooked chicken with house cured salts. A great treat for the timid taster. These were very good, but we're overshadowed by the rest of the food on the table. I still suggest trying these, they also have steak and pork belly skewers. 

Forbidden Black Rice. That's right... Forbidden Rice! This is something that Indiana Jones might go looking for in the Temple of Doom. Black Rice, seasoned with house made cured salt, enhanced with avocado, kabocha squash, red onion jam, cotija cheese, cilantro, and haricot vert (french for green beans). This veggie dish could convert any diehard carnivore to the dark side of the meat free force. I highly recommend this dish to everyone - The layers of this will please even the snobbiest and jaded of palates. The first bite will throw you off, it's crunchy, it's smooth, it's chewy, salty, and spiced. Like I said a shroomed-out unicorn came up with this meal. The cotija cheese is great addition to the meal pushing the salt flavor right up to the edge, while the medium boiled egg weirdly brings everything together.  

I wrapped everything up with a dessert item, that feels out of place on this menu. I blame it on that damn Unicorn! The, "Funkler" is ginger ice cream, a chocolate chip blondie, coconut sauce drizzle, and some crunchu sugary insanity. This is the type of dish, that as soon as you see it, you want say out loud, "Oh... fuck me", and I did. 

A hard five stars, the food, the service, ambience, and the sake. This place is on point, now if I could only find out where they keep that damn shroomed-out unicorn.

The Brussel sprouts are amazing. The fish is fresh the sushi melts in your mouth. A new local favorite for sure! The chef is awesome. Came out to check how everything was. Also the infused pineapple sake was delicious

The food wasn't all that great. We ordered the Short Rib Ramen and it was bland. If you want good Ramen, I would just go to Ramen Sora or Monta on Spring Mountain. 

We also ordered, Pork Buns, Foo Dog and Beef/Onion Skewers. Everything came out sub par. I was expecting the pork buns to be good, but the bun came out cold. From my past experience, you would expect the buns to be served warm. We also ordered Foo Dogs, it is essentially, a hot dog wrapped up. In all honesty, this dish could be easily made at home in 2 seconds. 

The beef skewers came out really late, about 40 minutes after we got all our other food. My husband also had to ask 3-4 times to refill his water & drink. 

Other than the food, the ambiance was comfy and cozy. That was the only positive of the restaurant. Overall, there are other better restuarant to try. I do not plan on coming back.

Very good food, but we received down right awful service. We had a 5:15 reservation for 8 - went early because we had a child who gets cranky near 7. There were only two other tables at that time so I thought we would get attentive service. Our waiter disappeared after taking our initial drink orders and telling us to order family style.

We saw him throughout the night helping others but he never came back to our table till he handed us the check. Instead, the poor busser ended up taking our orders as well as a bartender. I felt bad because it was not their job, yet we literally could not get  our waiter to acknowledge us. Thankfully the buss girl was very kind and apologetic for the bad service and clumsiness of the situation.
Sushi is INCREDIBLE. Can't suggest a specific item on the menu because they are all just as good. Great vibe and service not to mention a very good and reasonable price.

Came in for a quick lunch. The place was empty (albeit nicely decorated) but it took awhile to get a server to our table. Our server was all smiles but walked away from our table twice while I was mid sentence. (btw they never came back to check on us...oh well not a huge deal).
I asked pretty direct questions about a particular dish and was given the wrong item. It took awhile to get the server back to correct it while my co worker was eating her lunch. When the server finally came by (after some hand waving across the room) the response was: "Oh I misunderstood you". Again not a big deal but I asked two pretty direct questions about this particular item and don't know how a totally wrong dish was served. My guess It was put into the computer wrong. 
Took about 15 mins to get my correct order while my co worker was done eating. Again not something horrible but this was during my lunch break from work and I found this was mildly annoying. We were never checked on during our lunch. Not once. 
We both got ramen dishes and both felt the noodles were al dente to the point of being under cooked. The broth was extremely salty without much flavor.
No surprise I had to wave down our server to get the check. This place it somewhat of a chore to eat lunch at despite being mostly empty.
Two bowls of slightly below average ramen, one water and one tea with very spotty service for $30. I don't think Ill come back anytime soon.

Okay first off let's talk about cultural confusion. Lucky Foos? Sounds Chinese to me.. But overall definitely not Japanese. I know this place serves a variety of Asian foods but sushi is prominent on the menu and is Japanese. This is the main reason I didn't initially go here. But eventually I went. Cute place, nice decor. Waitress tells me this is an Izakaya which I am more than familiar with (japanese). And also goes on to tell me not to pour my own sake which.. I also knew but whatever. It's not a cultural lesson, right? 

First thing that came out was yakitori. Flavor was not so good but edible. Next we had "dumplings" which actually were luke warm gyoza. The crispy rice and lemon roll were both really awesome. Then we had the ebiyaki which was also really good. The only inedible part of the meal was the chicken wings. It was like two gigantic bird wings that you had to break apart with your hands to dip in the sauce and I felt so barbaric I couldn't finish it. 

Overall this place has a lot of potential, but needs to refine the small menu that they have. I've been to much better Izakayas in chinatown so that's my baseline and this place isn't up to snuff

Sushi was really good and chef was great at picking stuff for us, but of course everything he picked was super expensive. Ramen was not good, service was normal. I wasn't really too impressed and I doubt I would go back especially with all the amazing sushi restaurants we have in Henderson.

Was to meet some friends at Pho and they said it was where Melting Pot used to be, well I made a mistake and went where the Melting Pot used to be.  What a pleasant surprise.  The service was excellent, thank you Landon!  The food was absolutely delicious.  I will go back and maybe often.
Been here twice before for dinner but this is my first time for breakfast... I had the Kimme omelet and it is definitely a winner !!

If your looking for a family or even a night with the friends, maybe a couple night. This is the place for you. The forbidden rice is amazing, and don't get me started on the sushi rolls. AMAZING!!!! I have a question for you, have you herd of water ninja's but never had them for yourself? Then you really need to come here. The service is beyond amazing as well. I'm talking this place up with a lot of hype! Please believe me, over all Amazing. Check it out. :)

I love this place! Hard to describe it, but I call it my happy place. It's a restaurant, sushi bar, bar and lounge all under one roof.  Great food and amazing atmosphere! The Secret Weapon roll is the bomb. We needed something like this on this side of town.
Love this place took my wife here for her bday she loved the place ppl are very nice shout out to my waiter they make you feel welcome. The food is bomb

I came the first time for a YEE event and came back another time after time after that and this place is really great.

The restaurant is located on Eastern Avenue right by 215 which means that it is very easy to get there. Parking will also be easy. There are plenty of spots around the restaurant and it was never overly busy both times I was there.

Service is very good and so is the food. Make sure to try some of their sushi and the Funkler for dessert as I feel like this is one of their specialties. Good thing to know about this place is that they offer an AYCE option as well as a happy hour everyday from 3-6 pm.

In the end, I would definitely recommend this place as a must try in the Las Vegas area if you like sushi. Feel free to message me for any additional details that you may need!

My coworker received a flyer stating that they had a $3 promotional taco special for Cinco de Mayo. We decided to eat there because it's a quick walk from our office. I ordered the short rib tacos and she ordered the forbidden rice bowl. I was surprised to see my bill higher than I expected. When we asked the woman about the promotion, she said that the tacos only START at $2.50 and go up from there. The tacos were fine.. nothing spectacular and definitely not something I would pay $5 for again. My friend really likes her rice bowl and recommends that often.

The marketing got me in the door but I will definitely think twice about going back for a quick lunch.
Good atmosphere,  good drinks, but the food concept is a hybrid I can't get into..... good presentation but that's it

Over a week later and I am still frustrated over this experience. Came here on Tuesday, June 16 and dined with a longtime friend. Service started with high hopes of and enjoyable evening however after ordering our hopes were diminished. Arrived at 5:30p but we're not able to leave till almost 8pm because there was no service. We started with drinks then some happy hour appetizers and small entrees; which the food was good. After that we did not see anyone for almost 40min. Finally someone noticed us, because our server was no where to be found and she asked if we wanted dessert. We ordered our dessert and wanted to have some coffee with it. When our dessert arrived we were informed that they did not have coffee but only espresso and that they only did coffee on the weekends for brunch. We were disappointed but took the espresso. No cream or sugar was ever offered with the espresso and no one ever came back to our table after that. We waited another 15min for our check before we got up from the table and walk to the front, where there was also no one to attend to us. We finally waited in the middle of the front dining room and flagged down our server and informed her that we would like to pay; as we were about to just walk out; no one would have even noticed if we did. Once the server  finally stopped for us, she said "oh sorry, we have a large group in the other room we are all working on." I don't care, I just want to pay and leave at this point; my money ($75 check) is just as good as anyone else's money. The server never even came back to get the check for us, I just left it on a random table as we walked out. My friend and I have worked in management in F&B a long time and I have never been to a place that cared less about getting there money. Next time I have 2+ hours to blow, maybe I'll try this place again.....

The short rib ramen, pork belly steamed buns, lucky rice and house made chips. Get them. Idk what the chefs are doing back there, but they're doing it right. So much flavor and one of the best ramen dishes I've ever had, second to Jinya. I love pork belly and these steamed buns were fresh - not premade, frozen, and then reheated. A bit on the pricey side, but well worth it.

This is a very cool newish spot in town and I have been here a few times now. Their menu has a wide range of options, from sushi to ramen to steak and burgers. On top of that, they do all of it very well. Not the best in town but good enough to keep you coming back. 

Another plus of Lucky Foo's is the atmosphere... it's really tough to find a place in the Henderson area that actually has any character (or even without video poker machines at the bar), but Lucky Foo's is impressive on the eyes: sushi bar, patio, cocktail bar and even a room to watch movies and one with traditional zashiki (low to  the ground) seating. 

Service is friendly and good happy hour specials as well means you should for sure give this place a try.

I went here with my boyfriend last week and every single thing we are was amazing! We were able to watch the football game right at our table on a Sunday night. Our waitress was awesome and the restaurant is beautiful inside! I 100000 percent will go back prob next week :)
My friends have been raving about how great this place is, well we drove all the way from NW and weren't disappointed. Definitely a do over
I had a great experience with my daughter. Food was and his add the staff serving us. Loved their edamame! Lemon roll was delish!

Three visits in the past two weeks has given me a pretty good handle on Lucky Foo's (though all have been for lunch and brunch).  Here's the skinny:

FOOD: Everything I've tasted so far has been spot-on . . . sushi is very fresh, simple, "clean" and well prepared.  Haven't seen anything smothered in spicy mayonnaise yet so that's a plus!  Gravlax at brunch were great . . . served with crispy potato pancakes (latkes) and a nice dill flavored sour cream and assorted garnish.  I absolutely LOVE the signature Forbidden Black Rice Bowl . . . like to see some more variations of this.  I'd also recommend the "Taco Tuesday" menu . . . fun stuff for all.  Gonna' try some noodles on my next visit.

BEVERAGE: Plenty of interesting cocktails (14) and lots of beer (16) and sake (14) options.  Wine List is modest (23 selections) but pricing is fair and reasonable.  "Bottomless Mimosas" at Sunday Brunch for $18 a person along with "Build Your Own Bloody Mary" are both winners.

SERVICE: Staff is VERY friendly, accommodating and personable . . . they've obviously been well trained but you can tell right away that they "get" hospitality all the way around.  Great phone greeting on all my calls and prompt and attentive service by hostess' (Candace & Stephanie).

ROOM: Lots of options (which I like) . . . decent sized patio with comfy tables and chairs, indoor/outdoor sushi bar, booths and tables in the main room, more booths and tables in the bar area along with a more intimate private dining room that also has several tables and booths.  Lots of direct sunlight but also plenty of intimate spots . . . music ranges from classic rock to contemporary soul and dance music.  All very tasteful and comfortable.

VALUE: Considering the quality of the food, the service and ambiance, I'd say the Lucky Foo's offers and exceptional value by Las Vegas (or Henderson) standards . . . easy to have a nice lunch for two for $50 (with tip).  Our Sunday Brunch, with the Bottomless Mimosas for two was $90 (with tip).  Hard to imagine ANYONE in Vegas offering a better value than Luckys!

The new local spot is foo delicious! 

We stopped by late night and enjoyed the lemon roll, Philadelphia roll, wings and foo dogs. The sushi was fresh, the wings had flavors of ginger and soy to give them that Asian flavor, and the foo dogs were a fun take on pigs in a blanket, wrapped and fried in a potato slice and served with a mustard and sweet chili sauce. 

The place is a cool spot to grab drinks, dinner and of course a late night bite. We will be back!
Nice big  parking lot. Prompt / great service! Sake awesome! Lucky Rice w/chicken was delicious!
Very underwhelmed. They obviously ran out of short rib and gave my wife some sort or slice of beef...my lucky rice was oily goop...but the music and wait staff were great..
The food was great.  One of my new favorite sushi places in town.  The spicy tuna rolls were amazing and the giant fortune cookie is delish.  The chairs feel like toilet seat.  5/5.

First time visiting Lucky Foo's and I will definitely be back. The staff is very professional and attentive!! Enjoyed the set up of the restaurant, great atmosphere. 
I can not wait to go back to this great local spot to try more items on the menu. Highly recommend Lucky Foo's.

I had the pleasure of dining at Lucky Foos three times in the last month. Twice at lunch and once at dinner. Each time the staff , service and food exceeded my expectations. The sushi is the best I've had in a long time here in Vegas. In addition, there are several other enter selections that are to die for! If you are looking for a hot new restaurant , look no further !

Really good food but the price is a little steep. My husband and I went for dinner and drinks and enjoyed the experience.  Cocktail wise...my husband and I both tried the house Sake.  He also had the Asahi Super Dry beer while I had the Crouching Tiger.  After reading some of the reviews we decided to order the Foo Dogs, pork belly Ramen, Ebiyaki and one of the specials (Mariachi albacore "burrito").  As a whole the food was delicious...a little steep price wise but cooked very well. Overall the service was good and we both loved the atmosphere.

Seeing many positive reviews about this place and hearing some of my friends rave about it I decided to join a few of them for happy hour. 

My thoughts on the food will come but first lets discuss service...drum roll please....

The service was bad. With just about 4 or 5 tables sat in house Id think it would be better. Just for 1 sushi roll to come out it took about 30 minutes. When we asked where our food was the server simply said "were so busy im sorry were behind" 

Busy? OK. Lol I know what a busy restaurant looks like and it sure wasnt that.

Ok now on to the food. Ordered: 

Lucky rice, fried rice with chicken and a fried egg on top. Mind you usually anything with an egg on it is da bizness. And this rice sure was, so much I ordered 2.

Edamame, its charred, its good, its..edamame.

Eel cucumber, it was definitely fresh tasting I liked this one a lot

Eel avocado was good

Spicy tuna was too spicy, you can pretty much taste the chili powder since it had so much on it, all it needs is a hint. Its not chili powder with tuna

Lasagna roll, this was another hitfor me. But it does have cream cheese so those that dont like it wont like this. But this is also the roll that took about 30 min to get. I can imagine on a actual busy night how long it would take.

I might give this place a second try in the future.

I had the crispy rice surf and turf roll and I ended up having 3 most defiantly my favorite item here also had the bacon wrap shrimp you can never go wrong with that those were bomb! And also had the foo dogs I wasn't really impressed it was mediocre but overall the food was great!

Good sushi, but pretty overpriced. $30 and all I got was two rolls and dessert. The funkler is pretty great though! So rich! I could not finish it. But the outside was very hard and I had to use my fingers to eat it because my spoon couldn't get through it. 

I would totally come here again when I wanna spend that much money on dinner.

ATTENTION ALL FOODIES

Coming from LA, and as a recent local of the area, I have been searching far and wide for not only a place with deep understanding of flavor, but a place that provides me instagram worthy shots of food and my surroundings. 

This place exceeded all my expectations. The food was amazing! My boyfriend and I had the stellar nachos, lemon roll, lucky rice bowl, and spicy miso ramen (since they were out of the other ramen bowls). All of the dishes were very photogenic ;) and delicious! The service was on point from every waiter that helped us, and even the owner made sure to stop by for a friendly conversation. Being the pigs that my bf and I are, I love that they bring out the food as soon as it's ready. Furthermore, the ambiance was very nice! It is not what you expect from what you see on the outside. I recommend sitting on the outdoor area on a nice evening, and more importantly, I highly recommend trying this place!

We waited 5 mins to be seated and it is NOT busy (10pm).  I have my daughter  with me and shes only 18, the hostess  seated us  by the bar that has a sign said only 21 yrs or older in this area ( fail ).   We had  better ramen then this place. Pork belly skewed  was good. Steak with fries  for $28 is way over price.  

We are not coming  back.

I was disappointed by this place. As a fan of Asian food, I was excited to try an Asian Fusion restaurant near where I live. Their menu sounded good, and their prices didn't seem too bad.

To begin with, let me talk about the service. If it was an instagram post, it would just say:

#slow #stupid #shameful

Our waitress seemed like she had no clue what she was doing. And not because  she was new...she just seemed clueless. This did result in an incorrect order and her not being able to answer any of the questions we had for her. We did ask her for recommendations, but we got a simple "Everything is good" answer. (When I ask your opinion, please don't give me a canned answer. I ask for a reason: because I want a real, honest answer.)

Secondly, the food: It was okay. In my opinion, for food supposed to be in possession of "Asian flair", this stuff was a little on the boring side of things. At least that's what my taste buds registered. I'm hoping we just caught the chef on an off night with an empty spice rack.

Finally, the prices. They weren't bad, they weren't good. They were just fair. Had the food been what I would consider "good" rather than just "meh", the prices would seem even better.

Would I come back here? I would consider revisiting if they shake things up a little.
Would I recommend to others? Yes, because I don't want my opinion to necessarily convince someone to not go to this place. You might like it. I would just recommend you not going with super high hopes for a fantastic meal.
2 stars at its best. I'm being nice. I was very disappointed in their food. Ambience is good just the food sucks!

8 PM on a Saturday night, the place is virtually empty.  Only two parties of 2 in the whole place.  The entire restaurant reeks like a deep fryer (and so did we when we left).  There is a large open air bar between the patio and the sushi bar, and even that open wall did not help the thick smell that permeated the air.

Against better judgment we stayed because the reviews looked good.  Our CM gives this place 5 stars, so how bad could it be, right?  Well, the answer was: Terrible!  

We ordered chicken wings to start.  Our server asked if we wanted them out first, otherwise items would just come out as they were ready.  We advised that we'd like them first, as an appetizer.  Then ordered the Short rib ramen and the Thai beef salad for entr√©es.  Our wings never came.  After our entr√©es arrived and we found our server, we asked about the wings.  She said they should start making them now.  We asked to cancel them since they were supposed to come out prior to the other items.  She didn't want to cancel the wings for us so we spoke with the manager and asked her to do so.  After talking to the server and the kitchen, she agreed and advised that the 'ticket had been skipped'.  That does not seem like a valid excuse when the restaurant is empty.  It's not like orders were piling up.  In any case, it should not have taken that much effort to cancel an order.  Horrible customer service.

Now to the food we did eat.  I am sad to say that we found this to be terrible as well. Definitely very overpriced.  The ramen broth was a bit like fishy dish water, the limited amount of noodles in the bowl were generic, and the short rib almost see through the slices were so thin.

The salad was a joke.  I had asked if it was large enough for an entr√©e and was told that it was.  And at over $13, you'd assume so. There were 4 tiny pieces of hanger steak, no salad lettuce, just a bed of watercress with mint & cilantro, a few thin strips of papaya or mango, and grapefruit that was sour (possibly pickled?).  The steak itself was good, but there was not much of it and the rest was more of a garnish than a salad.

Sadly, I don't see a reason to return to this establishment.

What a great concept and awesome place esp for the local industry people in vegas to hang out, eat and drink without being overwhelmed by the strip. Finally a place on my side of town with great food. The Mac and cheese noodles were one of my favorite items we tried. I also recommend the rainbow roll with lemon on top! There is also a great selection of sake and the service was on point. Congrats to the ownership. Highly recommend giving this place a try.

Food was just ok and our service was a new personal worst :( 
We ate here about 3 weeks ago after the lunch rush, there were only a few tables left so a few servers were just stranding around chatting. we got sat within a few moments and a I gave our server my phone coupon from yelp with  free sake for checking and her ok'd and walked away. he came back a few minutes later with a free cold sake for me. I kind of would have like to order a water and ask a few questions.... but I guess it was good to get it out of the way? We had a few simple Q.'s about the menu and the server either didn't know the answer or was annoyed we asked- he gave us vague answers which made us have more questions. I think He was only working lunch and was not happy that he got sat another table, and it showed. 
Our food came, wrong... or not what he told us it would be- because he answered our menu questions with little effort and no information. So we had him get us what we thought we were ordering in the first place. 15 minutes later a new server came to bring us the food with a half smile trying to help correct the mood from the previous server and wrong food. 
Well the food was wrong, again but whatever we ate. Food was decent- nothing that great- nit hey they are pretty inexpensive. All the while no one filled up our water which is one of my biggest pet peeves. we had our empty glasses at the edge of the table trying to get their attention but they just did not realize them there and then I finally asked for more water and she came and took my glass to refill and left my fiances empty glass on the table? by the time she came back with my water we were ready to go- so we just asked for the check- paid in cash (still leaving 17% because I am a bartender and will never not leave a tip) and we left. Do not think I will come back to this place until they have been open for a while longer and have better service.

The ONLY reason for even 2 stars is for the food..which was okay at that. 

The service was absolutely horrendous. Waiter came over took our order and never saw him again. It was Monday night at 9, with only maybe 6 tables with customers.. Who were all ordering sushi and 1 sushi chef.. You do the math.

We ordered the charred edamame, spicy miso and 3 rolls. The food runner maybe was new? and delivered our edamame to a different table, which they sent back cause they didn't order it....then he came out with a miso ramen which again delivered to a different table, I had to flag him down to tell him it was ours, at that point I then told him that the edamame was also ours. It took 30 minutes just to get the edamame, 45 mins later still no sushi rolls, finally 2 came and then we waited longer for the 3rd which the food runner then delivered AGAIN to a different table. Which they took and ate, of course, probably cause they were starving like everyone else was that was waiting for sushi. We told the waiter and he seemed like he could care less so we got the bill and left. Was not going to wait another 30 minutes for another roll which we probably wouldn't have received anyways.
Went for lunch and it was great! The edamame was addictive! Can't wait to go back and try dinner there.

After reading the other reviews we had high hopes for this restaurant.  It does have potential, but they disappointed on many levels for us.  The restaurant is cool looking and has a hip vibe.  They seemed very distracted with moving tables and setting up for a DJ when we arrived for our 7 PM reservation on Saturday night.  Our table was not ready they said and had us wait at the bar.  I thought this was odd as I saw empty tables that appeared to be available.  They did give us some free Apple Sake, which was  nice of them.  We noticed they had boxes and cleaning spray bottles on the counter where they sat us which we found as not appropriate.  I think you should be set up and  better prepared by 7 pm on a Saturday.  After we got seated, they continued to move tables and chairs all around us, which was distracting.  Our waitress was nice and professional, but seemed a little distracted also.  We ordered several things, and none of them really wowed us.  The chicken robata was very, very salty, almost sent it back it was so bad.  The other food was good, but again nothing special.  The highlight of the meal was the dessert, which was the Snowball.  A delicious ball of chocolate and marshmallow that was fun and tasty.  I can see this place has potential.  The menu is unique and fun, and the place has a cool vibe.  They just need to focus on execution and service.  For example, we had to ask for water three times and utensils and plates on more than on occasion.  When you serve fished like fried rice to share,m you need a spoon and plates also.  They seem to be working some kinks out as they are still a new restaurant.  We may try them in a few months after they get their service in place better.          One other thing, the main entrance is on the side and not easy to see from the parking lot.  We saw many people enter from the patio entrance which faces the parking lot and then they looked confused as to where to go.  They need to make that more clear to people as to where the entrance is.

We've driven past this place several times just not sure what to expect. Saturday night we decided to give it a try. We sat on the patio (perfect night) had the scallop yum yum roll for appetizer, salmon entree, brussels side dish, and panna cotta for desert. Every single dish was truly amazing. I don't "yelp" unless something is extremely good or extremely bad. This place is a gem! Definitely going back!!! The only downside is I would've like a nice coffee with desert and they only had espresso (starbucks is in the same location so we ordered a to go).

I came here for Restaurant Week.  There was no special menu for RW.  Rather, the RW menu was a choice of existing items.  When added up, the cost from the menu was $2 less if you ordered √† la carte than the price they charged for their RW menu.  Their $4 contribution per RW order then is half paid by the customer.  Tacky, but it's OK.  It was not OK to be on the RW page for weeks and not yet have any menus available.  Instead, I was brought a tablet with the menu from the HelpOutDineOut website.  

For the three courses, I ordered the charred shishito peppers, the forbidden black rice, and the funkler.  There was one other party in the restaurant when I got there at 5 and it took ten minutes to find out they had no RW menus, show me the tablet, order, and get an iced tea.

The food was hit and miss.  I liked the shishito peppers.  Charred very nicely, they were quite flavorful and as with most peppers, they varied with their heat.  The accompanying aioli really didn't have much flavor.  I think it was there to help cool some patrons' palates who might find the peppers too spicy.  Next came the forbidden black rice.  It was a nice mixture with the star being the kobacha squash.  I could discern none of the promised mint, cilantro, or Thai basil.  I was about 2/3 of the way through my rice when a server committed what I consider the ultimate serving error.  My dessert, the funkler--a  warm blondie with ice cream--was placed on the bar next to my bowl of unfinished rice.  Didn't anyone watch to see when I was done or did someone just decide to send out dessert when they decided it was the right time.

At that point, I raised the bowl of rice, tipped it toward me, and started pushing the rice from the bowl with my chopsticks.  I should have told him to take it back becasue I wasn't ready but I opted to finish and cut my losses.

The blondie was poor.  It was very hard and very dry.  I had to push very firmly with my fork to break through the blondie.  I should have let the ice cream melt over it and soften it a bit.  I don't know how long it had been sitting around but it was obviously too long.  What a disappointment--in service and execution.

During my meal, I was asked if I wanted more iced tea.  After 5 minutes, the person looked over and snapped his finger as he realized he'd forgotten the tea.  This was indicative of the service during my visit.  No one seemed to know what they were doing.  The dessert error, though, was the most fundamental error any restaurant can commit.  It just should never be done!   Lucky Foo's needs to address their service issues.  They are not training their people or they just don't care.

I paid my bill and left, sorry that I had chosen Lucky Foo's to begin my Restaurant Week dinners.  What a disappointment!!

Really Yelp reviewers, 4 out of 5 stars? I came here based on this rating and I think everyone who rated this place over 3 stars should pull together and give me my $80 back lol. 

First, we came in around 3:30 on a Sunday and the service was not great. Halfway though an Asian chick took over our table and she was really nice so I'll let that go. 

We ordered the spicy tuna roll, mariachi roll, pork belly ramen, sashimi salad and our kids had the fried rice and chicken finger bento box. The ramen was so bland and disappointing, it looked really pretty and we had high hopes. There was no real flavor, and what we did taste was just off. The spicy tuna roll was nothing special. The mariachi roll sounded so good but all we could taste was the sweet onion in it. It didn't taste anything like cilantro, salmon, salsa or any of the elements that were in the menu description. The sashimi salad was soooo bland as well. Just like eating basic lettuce with a hint of lemon. Very sad that both me and my husband's favorite thing was the iced tea, especially when it came out to about $80. Blah.

It was a blessing in disguise when I tried to bring my parents to the 30 minute long wait at Sunrise Cafe on Mother's Day after church. Lucky Foo's did not have a line, and my dad gets grumpy when he is hungry so we decided to venture over there. 
When we walked in, we were greeted very warmly by 2 women who gave us a 5--10 minute waiting period. I definitely felt that "new restaurant" vibe because we were asked by about 3 different people if we'd be helped/assisted/ordered yet. Which is fine, you could just tell they wanted to impress :-)

I don't why, but the thought fusion food turns me off. That makes no sense cuz I'm a very eclectic person! I was a little wary to eat there at first, but I ordered the chicken katsu and waffles. The katsu had a...different flavor that maybe I'm not used to since I'm so familiar with Aloha Kitchen's katsu. The waffle was delicious though and the plate was presented very nicely. My mom though. She got the Forbidden Black Rice bowl!?!!!!! 

That mess was amazing! So good that I went back 2 days later just to order it. I've never had black rice before and all the flavors they combined are so complementary of each other. It's a bit pricey for how much food you get, but asking around, I heard that black rice is fairly exclusive and all the ingredients were probably similar. 

The manager (Michael, I believe) approached our table to ask about our meal and hooked my dad up with a card and a coupon. Our server Sandee was really friendly and well versed on the menu. $50 for a flavorful Mother's Day brunch is not bad at all.

I'll be back for that black rice bowl and probably some other things.

This is a great spot with top-class food and drinks on offer.
We had the fried rice, inferno sushi, hot dogs and a few beers. Very good food and the service was top-notch. Will be back for sure.
Ignore poor ratings on Yelp, just unhappy people, there is so much on offer in this place
Wish it was closer to the strip, would have done really well

I don't understand the previous high ratings when there are so many great sushi spots in the area. This was nothing special. The lemon roll was good, the short rib ramen was flavorless. Monta Choya ( down the street) is a billion times better. A billion. The ambiance is cool but our waiter was one of the worst I've ever had. Awkward and confused and forgot about us over and over. One of the only times ever  we've EVER left less than 20% tip (full disclosure - we left 10% -it was that bad). 


The shishito peppers were bland (Spicy Tuna and Monta are WAY better and down the street) and Osaka's lasagna roll (also down the street) puts Lucky Foo's lasagna roll to shame. 

Won't be going back.

This has to be the best sushi restaurant in Henderson! !  We have tried several in the area and we have been always disappointed.  So excited to try this new restaurant.  It did not disappoint.  We started with the Kale & Pear Salad. Amazing presentation. The flavors were excellent. Went on to the Brussel Sprouts. Perfectly prepare. Hot and crunching in a sauce that was perfection. Then did a spicy hand roll, lemon roll, caterpiller roll and fennel roll. All were flavorful and delicious. Will return!! The restaurant is sectioned off for a more intimate dining experience.  The bar area has plenty of tv screens going to make everyone happy. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable.

This place is amazing and so much fun. I celebrated my 40th Birthday here and everything was perfect. My friends and I were so impressed with the food and service. We tried a variety of rolls, appetizers and noodle/rice dishes and everything was very tasty. We will definitely return and recommend to others. 
Thank you to the staff for such a memorable night.

The wait staff and owner were amazingly attentive and informative. The food was a wonderful exploration of an exceptionally creative menu and a chef that can execute on every dish. Bring your appetite and enjoy.

Great food!! Came in last weekend for dinner with a few friends. We all enjoyed it very much. Food was great, not too heavy and the staff was awesome. We had a great experience. Drinks were pretty fantastic too. :)

Cali roll was delish and ramen was huge it probably served 3+. Only thing service was so slow and had to constantly ask for everything (sweetener for tea, soy sauce for rolls etc). Took nearly 1hr for a singkespider and cali roll and ramen. Not a great place for a 1 hr lunch was late back to office a block away :( Might try again at dinner.

We were told to come to this place and after going....I have no idea why. We walked in and it was super hot! It was cooler outside than it was inside. They seat us in these awkward tables that are supposed to be like booths. We order our sushi rolls and our kids menu items. We waited 45 minutes and still no sushi. We asked when it was coming and they said our order was up next to be made. After 45 minutes it wasn't even started!?There were maybe 15 people in the entire place eating....how could it take so long? We wait another 10 minutes and they say he's still working on our rolls and their main sushi guy left so they only have one. We then asked for our check and left. It kinda worries me that it was so hot inside(I don't think that's a good environment for raw fish...). The other thing is our kids' food was awful! So I'm glad I spared myself because the sushi probably would have been bad anyways. Super under staffed and horrible service. Don't bother!

First time here and we will be back! Edamame was the best I've had. The service is above and beyond great. Had 2 different sushi rolls loved the Hawaiian roll the best!! Service super great! Manager actually comes over and is genuine with wanting feedback. Just overall fantastic experience !! Highly recommend.

Decided to give this place a second try. There won't be a third. 
My first experience was pretty good, and I thought that this time it would be even better. 
Sitting there and just kind of relaxing a little made me realize what kind of place this is. 
First off I went in with my 2 sons. They don't eat like kids, they've eaten just about everywhere and get how things are supposed to go. I ordered shishito peppers, lemon roll, and pork belly skewers for appetizer. My youngest son got the short rib ramen, my oldest wasn't that hungry so ordered a Hawaiian roll, and I ordered forbidden rice bowl. The server looked flustered when I ordered the food and said I'd like this for an appetizer and that for a dinner. She says with exasperation in her voice "the food comes out as its ready". Oh. Alright I say thinking it should be ok. Well, how is it that almost everything came out in different a different order. My oldest son was left sitting there with no food for quite awhile after both my youngest and me were finally served. Lol, and then an appetizer comes out 5 minutes into our dinner. I noticed at a table close to us that a different server was explaining the same "food comes out as its ready" to a party of 4 senior citizens. She was rolling her eyes and sounded very annoyed. The crazy thing is they were just ordering. It's not like they were complaining they were just asking questions that were pretty basic. 
Forbidden rice. Pretty. Basic and bland tasting, but very pretty. Rolls were good. Shishito peppers were fine...they were as good as the ones I made last week. Short rib ramen was ok. Last time I went I guess I was just in a good mood. 
If you're going to label the menu with a starters category then you should make them starters. The place looks cool, and some of their food is tasty, but I'd like some steak to go with my sizzle.

I came in  saturday night sat at the end of the sushi bar with one of my friends. I enjoyed the house cabernet and the tai beef salad . My friend loved the brussel sprouts and foo dogs. I had a great experience here and I would recommend everyone to come here. Our server candi did an amazing job! She was wonderful and pleasant!

Lucky Foos makes me smile like a lucky fool!! This is one of my favorite local spots. Let's start with the welcoming atmosphere of the restaurant. I love that depending on what mood I'm in I can choose between sitting at the lush bar, in a cozy booth, at the sushi bar, out in the enclosed patio. I mean, who doesn't appreciate choices? The space is decorated so nicely. Beautiful, vibrant colors, unique kitchy artistry all tied together with an authentic theme. 

Now for the food...aww the delicious food. Some of my favs include the charred shishito peppers (I order these EVERY time I'm here), the chicken robata skewers (so succulent and juicy), and the pork belly ramen (oh. mah. gawd!). You're welcome! Seriously, you must try all three of these items. The forbidden rice is another excellent choice if you're not in the mood for soup. I would recommend you make multiple visits here because after you eat all of my personal recommendations you probably won't have room for dessert, but you HAVE to try the Funckler!!! I've had dreams about this amazing blondie topped with delicious ice cream. 

BTW, they also have a brunch menu! I highly recommend the chicken and waffles. Again, you're welcome! ; )
Food is so good, staff is super nice, the place is cute! But why the small portions? I'm a tiny girl and I left hungry! It's just ramen people and it's 10 cents, don't be so stingy.

From walking into ambiance that makes you feel like you're not in Vegas to amazing, attentive and super friendly staff/managers, add great food at reasonable prices and you've got a secret-ish goldmine. Stellar Chips are a must have, sake flights a great addition and you can't go wrong with anything you order for a meal!!! Two thumbs up!! We'll be back!!
I'm not into Asian food so I can't rate the food but I love the atmosphere. Would definitely go another time for drinks.

Everything from the kimmi dolls to the pork belly ramen, this place is great! Kid friendly environment with adult atmosphere. Price great with expensive taste! Can't wait to go for happy hour. Salt scrub for hands in bathroom a nice free luxury. We didn't take pictures of food because we didn't want to stop eating to take them.

I can't believe I waited so long to try this place! They have an awesome happy hour, great prices, and the food is delicious! They have the best edamame I've had in a long time. They steam it, char it, and toss it in a yummy sauce with toasted garlic. They also top their spicy tuna roll with toasted garlic. Yum!! I will definitely be back for sure.

So I had high hopes after seeing the pictures online and they continued on when I entered. The place had a fun vibe to it. Cool pop art all over the place, vivid colors.  We were promptly greeted, and given a menu to look at while we waited for a table.  The menu had lots of cool looking fusion items on it, and I was so excited.  So we settled on the Hawaiian roll, the fennel role, short rib ramen, and the chicken fried rice.

  First thing that came was the ramen, it was 12 dollars and about a 3 rd the size of what I would get at monta.  The meat at least was tender, good cook on the egg, and the broth had good flavor although a bit too salty. They did give us two extra bowls since we were sharing, which I appriciated.  Then the fennel roll came out, the rice was so sticky and the peices stuck together.  It was also bland.  Kinda tasted like tuna salad.   The Hawaii roll came out and it tasted like a bland California roll with some mango on it.  These rolls were around 14 dollars. Way to much money for poorly executed rolls.  Then finally the fried rice, way to wet and not harmonious at all.  Just to many things happening without any balance.  

Even though we really didn't enjoy our food nearly enough, the staff was great.  I will say this is not a place to bring a kid, more an adult vibe.  I am tempted to go back just to try the lychee panecotta, but scared of another lovely sounding item not coming together.

Located in the LVAC center on Eastern. Ok so this is the latest in a long line of restaurants that have been in this location since I have lived in Las Vegas (8 years) I wish them luck, it's a good location, they have a good happy hour, the food and service were very good, so they have fighting chance. I will go back and try some more things on the menu for a more comprehensive review but for now I say stop by and check it out! Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

I've been hearing good things about this restaurant for awhile now. I finally gave it a try for dinner and was not disappointed. The regular menu offers an interesting variety of food items. 

I started with Stellar Chips because they sounded unique. They were so good. For a fried wonton it was fairly light and not greasy. Think Asian tortilla chip. The dip that came with it was delicious as well. 

The Short Rib Ramen immediately caught my attention for my meal. Every item in the bowl was perfectly prepared. The egg was cooked to the point that the yolk was almost set, but was still creamy without being running. The short rib was very flavorful and I could have eaten at least twice as much. The other flavors blended so well including the bamboo shoots, nori, onions, and perfectly salted broth. The entree portion was the perfect amount of food for me and reasonable for the price.

I finished up with The Funkler which is a chocolate chip cookie/brownie with ice cream on the top. It came with a cup of chocolate in case you don't already have enough. The portion on this was huge. I wouldn't recommend getting this for one person. It was very rich and bold on chocolate flavor. I absolutely loved the flavor, but it became rich fast.

The service was mixed. When I arrived the hostess greeted me quickly and gave me options in seating. Other employees greeted me as we walked to my seat. Then I sat at the bar and was the only person at the bar because I was there at an off time. The bartender managed to say less than a dozen words to me the whole time I was there even though I was his only customer. The girl that was bringing out the food was very friendly and made nice conversation with me. 

While I was there I noticed that they do special nights like Tacos and Tequila as well as Sunday brunch. I'll definitely be back to try some of the other items that caught my eye.

Lucky Foo's is a great restaurant and bar. Not only is the food amazing, but they have a great happy hour and lunch is great too. I go to this place at least once per week and probably out drinking there one night per week.

Came here with my work on a Friday afternoon for Happy Hour. They were very accommodating of our reservation especially because there were 20+ of us. They were also very good with service and splitting checks.

Food is good!  I got the sashimi ceviche which was pretty tasty. Coworkers said they enjoyed their selections. 

Great to know that there's a good, upscale Japanese inspired restaurant close by. Only thing is that it was a little dark inside. The bar area seemed like a great place too.. especially now that it's warming up.

I'd come here again.

went to visit the establishment and absolutely loved the layout and decor! I love that they serve sushi but it is a fully accomodating menu so it is easy to visit with mixed parties that may not all be seafood lovers. All of the staff was very nice as I peaked my head around. I have also heard great things about the management/owners!

This place is great. Whenever I am here, the owner gives us a personal greeting to make sure that we are having a good experience. I have been here for dinner, lunch, and the weekend brunch experience. Everything has been exceptional. I love sushi, but the creations of their chefs are unique and interesting like nothing I've had before.

First time checking out this new restaurant.  Great new look with a cool atmosphere.  The music was good at a nice level for having conversations.  Went with a big group and they accommodated our party and seated us very quickly. The food came out fast and in good fashion with sushi being first and hot food coming after. The food was great, the fennel roll was amazing, had to order another. Will definitely be coming back to try the rest of the menu.

James was awesome made the experience super fun and even offered some great options on the menu. I would deff recommend this place to anyone looking to try something new in the sushi scene or just some Asian fare. sake was a bit on the stronger less tasty side but not terrible and the fish is super fresh love it!

Came here with my wife and out of town guest, loved the decor and ambiance of the whole place. Everyone was very knowledgable and professional.there were so many delicious choices to make and weren't sure what to order. The owner overheard our dilemma and approached our table to give us the menu tour of his favorites and guest favorites! Cocktails were on point also!

After my first time coming here for a YEE I was hooked and needed to come back for more. First of all I love the interior of this place. It's super spacious and has a trendy fun style to it. Another thing that I love about this place is that they have happy hour everyday 3-6 pm. Who doesn't like a good happy hour? 

Now on to the food! My bae and I split the stellar nachos as an app. The wonton chips were crispy and fresh, the sauce to dip in was fantastic and there was a generous amount of ahi tuna. For an entree I had the rib eye ramen. I really enjoyed the flavor of the meat and the broth. My boo opted for the one and only foo burger which looked delicious. He let me steal a few of his fries which were cooked perfectly and I really liked the spicy ketchup to dip in.

Can't forget about the drinks either! They have tons of specialty cocktails and beers but I opted for the fruit infused sake. It was served in an adorable bamboo style carafe and I believe the flavor I had was grapefruit and mint. It was very unique and refreshing oh and half off for HH.

Honestly I can't get enough of this place. I'm sure I'll be back again soon & can only keep my fingers crossed for a southwest expansion location.

Went in with high expectations of the the food and service and came out with a not so great experience. It was a party of three and we were seated immediately because it was dead! And might I add it was 7pm on a Saturday and there was no one there! Our waiter was nice and sweet, she checked on us frequently but it didn't make up for the food. The ramen broth isn't quality it lacked flavor, the noodles weren't as al dente as I expected or like, it was an interesting mix with short rib but it wasn't something I expected. I was thinking a sweet short rib and it was heavily charred. The prices are decent but definitely not worth the flavor and content. It was nice trying it but I wouldn't go back.

Very average. 
The restaurant itself is great, nice inside with a very cool hip atmosphere.
The service was good too, the server was nice and attentive.
I felt the food was just average.. ordered off the normal& sushi menu. 
The steamed pork bun for appetizer was not very good at all...
Ramen soup was decent, i expected better.. And sushi again was just okay.. Nothing really wowed me on the food

It really is too bad I discovered Lucky Foo's after I moved out of Las Vegas, otherwise I would undoubtedly become a regular. I adore everything about this place, from the lovely decor with the beautiful dolls to their friendly management and staff. 

First thing I noticed and found very impressive was their beverage program. Usually when I walk into an Asian restaurant, I do not have the highest expectations on the alcohol selection, so I was quick to assume I'll end up ordering an Asahi or whatever typical product every other Americanized Japanese restaurant carries. Lucky Foo's, however, had an extensive spirits display, craft beer, craft cocktails with house made syrups, premium sake, and even a carbonated sake I had never heard of on tap. It is refreshing to see an establishment outside of New York City that actually cares to carry uncommon, better quality products that people aren't familiar with. To those of you who are less adventurous, don't fret because they do carry Asahi, Sapporo, Stella Artois, etc. on top of the good stuff ;)

Their food menu has something for whatever craving you may have. Let's say your friends aren't really in the mood for Asian cuisine but you really want that bowl of ramen. Bring them here and they won't be disappointed in their panko crusted chicken sandwich or a make-your-own burger, all the while you can enjoy their pork belly, short rib, or miso ramen (if you're anything like me, ask for it spicy because they have thai chilis). 

Go during happy hour 3pm-6pm for great deals on some of their rolls and appetizers, including the yakitori (pork belly is a must), and of course $3 off their specialty craft cocktails such as the Crouching Tiger, which I'm told is a staff favorite. 

Overall, service is fantastic, food and drinks are great, and the prices are extremely reasonable. The ambience is suitable for pretty much any occasion - a casual lunch, a celebratory dinner, brunch with friends or even a romantic date. I highly recommend this place to anyone in Vegas looking for a more original Asian fusion establishment that's not like all the rest.

Delicious food! They bring their shefs from Abroad!  

Well done guys!! Thank you for great service

"How cool is that!" Was the phrase I kept reiterating while the two young owners gave me a tour of this establishment. Lucky Foo's has only been open a few months, but it's easy to see they've got a bright future ahead of them.

The location is freeway close  right off of the Eastern/215 exit. I really like that (for a quick getaway?). Also, you can "customize" your experience by choosing to dine/lounge/play in a different room each time you come over.

 Patio?  Check!  Sushi bar?  Check!  Tatami room with fun mats and a giant futon for your lounging pleasure? Check!  Happy hour?  Check!  Wi-Fi?  Check!  An interactive dj app that allows you to control what music you hear next?  Yeah, this place is definitely for the hip and fun crowd.

For those who didn't know, I'm a host of a certain dating website's social mixer events, and I host at various venues throughout the city. I have never been to the Lucky's  before (can I call you, Lucky's?  Yeah, I'm going there), but I definitely want to come back in my private time as a customer. Every one of my singles was impressed by this place, too! 


This restaurant/lounge can only get better with their amazing food, thoughtful staff and exciting venue. I even start to one customer who said they'd been there every week day for the past 2 months, since they've been open. If that isn't a glaring testimonial, then I don't know what is... I can't wait to see what they do next!

The food is great here! The sushi was fresh and very tasty.  The burger was also amazing and I like how the fries was not salty.  The free sake infused with mango was disgusting! But I overheard the other waiter offer house sake (hot/cold) to the other table. Why were we not offered that? Don't know but that annoyed me.

The food here was great. Everyone was really nice and very helpful. It just took a really long time for us to get our sushi order, my kids were completely finished with their food by the time we finally were served. That was a bummer :(

We've taken two swings at this great spot. 
The first visit was for dinner. We were offered menu options from happy hour and really enjoyed adding those options. It was a busy night and we ended up eating several spicy rolls to curb our appetite. Dinner and service were top notch!
Our second visit was for brunch. The patio was a great offering. Brunch offerings were freshly prepared and had a wonderful twist on favorites!

Cute and zen atmosphere-flavorful food! 

I recommend the forbidden rice bowl (black rice- SO good for you) but everything has been wonderful every time we go; which is a couple times a month. It's in an easy-to-get-in-and-out-of Green Valley location.
We love the black rice and the sushi menu is great too. The fortune cookie dessert is super tasty and fun. 
The owner has sat and chatted with us before; he put a lot into Lucky Foo's and you can tell he is passionate about it.

Awesome place for dates and/or outings with friends!

A beautiful new place for an incredible dining experience in Las Vegas. As a local, it's so nice to be able to find this kind of upscale atmosphere, reasonable pricing and amazing food without having to go to the Strip. My group and I tried many different items from the menu and not one of them disappointed. Quite frankly, they were all fantastic! The versatility of the many rooms creates an environment that can be enjoyed by any size party. The service was exemplary and the music was at the perfect level to enjoy without upstaging the table conversation. It's obvious the owners took great pains and thoughtful care in creating a beautiful restaurant and bar that is built to last. Needless to say, I shall return. Well done, Lucky Foo's.

Their specialty dishes are very unique.  The spicy tuna nachos are amazing. Some of my favorites are: lemon roll and the edamame is a must.  For desert also try the chocolate chip cookie with fudge and vanilla ice cream - yummy
We celebrated a birthday in the Tatami room.  Beautiful private room, we sat on cushions  in a very cozy setting.

I've been here twice during happy hour.  Both times we sat out outside. The patio area is very nice...perfect for enjoying nice weather, drinks and  some sushi! The sushi quality is definitely above average compared to other local Vegas joints I've been to.  I even ordered a sashimi platter the first visit and I was pleasantly surprised! - good quality, tasty fish!  Lucky foos fills the void in Vegas for good sushi places that have a happy hour with outdoor seating, especially in that area of town.
 I like that they have classic cocktails on the drinks menu and a decent wines by the glass selection as well.  I'm not sure if there's a separate dinner menu as we have only seen the one with happy hour and rolls. 
We will definitely be back!

Man ! I can't get enough of these lucky foo's . Had a couple of the crudo dishes tonight . OMG! So dang freaking delicious . Like slap your mama goodness . The flavors of each components just compliments the fresh fish so well.

First, I have to say the service was great. Our waitress and host were both super nice and attentive. I also liked the atmosphere. Outdoor seating is always a plus. 

The food was good but not great. We all liked our food but nothing was worth raving about. I had the stellar chips (tasty - skip the sauce it comes with and use the sweet chili sauce), veggie lettuce wraps (meh), and the Brussels spouts (I'd ask them to skip the sauce or put it on the side next time - flavor was overwhelming). My boyfriend got the steamed pork pot stickers (super good!) and the short rib ramen (I didn't try but he liked it well enough). My friend got two sushi rolls: yellowtail (very good) and lucky summer roll (pretty much a vietnamese spring roll, basil was too much and overpowering).

I would go back again if someone invited me and they were set on this place, but won't be rushing back. While it wasn't a bad meal, there are too many other places in the area I enjoy more.
"c" rating from the Health Dept. hanging on the wall....NOT COOL

Walking up to the restaurant I did not expect the interior of the place to look as nice as it did. It was a very relaxed atmosphere with a mix of modern-asian decoration. The staff did an excellent job of greeting and helping us find our table for our party to get settled. The real reason for the 2-star rating was the disappointing serving size of the food. I ordered the pork belly ramen and it is truly about 2/3 smaller than your typical serving at other ramen restaurants. The dishes ranged from 15$ and up which is why I expected a much bigger order. The ramen bowl was salty and the flavor could have been more intense. Our table also ordered some cut rolls which actually met expectations.

The chef came out to our table and introduced the Foo Foo Dogs saying that he invented it and said something like the sauce was made with Tonkatsu..and the hot dogs were sausages from a place in Japan. They didn't taste special. 

The service was great and the people were nice but the food needs to be improved.

As a self proclaimed sushi guru, this restaurant is top notch in my book. The rolls here taste amazing, we started with something simple " vegas roll"   delicious, well balanced and constructed perfect.  Next was the spicy tuna roll and California roll. Spicy tuna was spicy but perfect.  
 Bartender was great, put the hockey game on one of the many TV's at the bar. 

Lots of sushi joints in Vegas feel cheap and dirty, this location does not, its clean and way cool. Good music playing, nice people, dope atmosphere.  Owner of this joint should get a Hi five!

I've never had such a disgusting food experience anywhere in Las Vegas! You couldn't pay me to eat here again.  I don't get how the owners/managers can serve such horrible quality food with a clean conscience.  
The shrimp was raw, the meat was burnt and every single dish had the same nasty sauce all over it.  Gross! Don't ever eat here.
Great atmosphere!!! Great Sushi!!! Music is very eclectic and wonderful not that same stale restaurant style.  So enjoyable makes you wanna order dessert:)

I have heard some good reviews from yelp and facebook for Lucky Foos so I was excited to try the food here when I went for the sake testing night that was hosted in this place last night. When I first arrived, I was amazed on the nice Asian zen decor and such a spacious place. Service was on point, however, food was not. 

Food:

1. Lucky rice(1/5): This is the dish I was excited to try since everyone was raving about it. This dish has kimchi, bacon, chicken and fried eggs. It was really really salty. I had to drink a sip of water each time I had a bite. The flavor was not bad but it was way too salty and has too much sauce. For $7, I didn't really see much chicken in there. 

2. Spicy salmon roll (3/5): I know better not to order sushi in fusion restaurant but my friend wanted a roll. It was mediocre and plain. 

3. Shrimp with jalape√±o bacon robata skewer (3/5): it wasn't too bad but they used too much sauce when bacon was already salty. 

4. Mushroom mazemen (3.5/5): this dish has mushroom, pea spouts, Parmesan cheese  and noodle. It has all my favorite ingredients and it was not salty thank god! This ended up being the favorite of ours for that night but it was not that great either.

Overall dining experience was underwhelmed. Although it's a nice place to hangout and grab a drink, I doubt I will be retuning anytime soon for the food.

I've been to this restaurant now about 5 times, and it's still just 3 stars to me. The service is hit or miss. 2 out of the 5 times I've been here, service has been good. The other 3, service was just terrible. 

The food again is usually soooo good!  We tried out brunch the first day, and it was okay. My friend ordered the chicken fried steak and it was NOT good. My skillet was yummy but a very small portion. My other friend ordered the steak and eggs and her dish was by far the best. However, all portions are very very small. We had to order a side because we were still starving.

The last time I went with a couple of friends, we ordered a ton of things, but the main thing to point out is that the black forbidden rice bowl was crunchy and chewy and not cooked all the way. When our server came back, we told her and her response was, "You should've told me right away," which is funny because we hadn't seen her at all since the food was dropped off like 15 minutes ago.  Anyway, she was nice enough to take it off the bill since it was inedible and we had barely touched it, but her reaction was just funny.

Very impressed by lucky foos! We went for brunch/lunch. We got the charred edamame to start which was awesome and a fruit bowl for my little one. We got the burger which was awesome and the fried rice with sausage which was okay. As a side we added the hash which was really good too. Since we made a reservation online we got a free chocolate chip cookie cake with ice cream and chocolate coconut sauce. It was awesome, must get. We will be back next time.
Inviting atmosphere, amazing food, good looking and friendly staff..Lucky Foos exceeded our expectations..I think my Husband and I found our new favorite date night spot..

This place is Wayyy better than the old sushi with place that was here before. The food is Aweosme very creative fusion tapas type serving and oh sooo good. I
 Super stuffed ordered from the happy hour menu which was extend because of the foozeball game..nicely done mr.owner appreciate that good sir! Anyways come check out their yummy edamame,lasagna roll,chicken skewer,hotdog In
Chip thing-a-Mahbob and cheesy ramen noodle..I will be back and conquer more of your tasty menu item so if your reading my review don't hesitate just come on check this place out.

Funkler and Snowball.... Great desserts!

This place is going to be a solid four star in the future.  I have been here twice now in the past week and I really like the food.  To have a tapas, asian fusion place in Henderson is pretty cool and with all the cool cats hanging out at the LVAC, I am sure this place will be a "go-to" restaurant in the future!

1.  Location - 3 star - This is at the 215 and Eastern on the NorthWest corner.  Near the LVAC and in the place that was formerly Xtreme Sushi and Steak.  Very similar upscale and funky interior with a great exterior patio seating.  It was almost warm enough to attempt to sit outside, however we were ill prepared.  There are a variety of tables, booths and plenty of sizing for large or small groups. Love the location, but it is difficult to get to at times due to all the traffic and all.  However, if you can navigate here, you will do well.

2  Ambiance - 4 star - As mentioned, plenty of tables and booths.  A small cool bar in the middle as well as a small sushi bar off to the side.  In my two times here, I did not see people really hanging out at either bar, yet when this place get's busier and it will, I am sure it will be hopping. 

3.  Food - 5 star - The food here is definitely very good, and we have tried so far many of the dishes. 

Lucky Rice - Some concoction of sticky rice perfectly flavored with kim chee, fried egg and bacon.  We added the pork belly option and this is a dish that you will keep on eating and eating.  Tasty and addicting.  The only problem with this dish is slowing down a bit to taste it.  The texture, flavor and taste is just about perfect.  This is something we will eat every time.  We had both the regular Lucky Rice with all the meat and one vegetarian one without meat as it is Lent....

Lettuce Wraps - They have both the vegetarian and one with chicken.  We ordered the vegetarian and it was great, when we did get it.  It had Mushroom, Daikon, Eggplant and Carrots.  Great flavor and of course fun to eat in the little lettuce wraps that they give to you.

Shishito Peppers - These were cooked to perfection.  Nice taste, not spicy, just a hint of pepper.  More vegetable but cooked to a nice crispy and charred texture.  Made this so flavorful and mouth watering. Yes, you have to enjoy veggies to like this, and I have had Shishito Peppers at many places and enjoyed it here so much!

For the RobataYaki, we had Chicken and Scallion,  Kabocha Squash, and Maitake Mushrooms  These were all very good, tasty, and served on little platters with the skewered delicacies!

Fries - Yes, we ordered something as dopey as fries.  It was a Friday, most of us were on "Lent" so no meat. We were hungry, and heck the fries looked good.  You know what, as odd as it seems, and I am an Asian Foodie, I really enjoyed the fries and I normally never order fries or eat them!

The Dessert - The Funkler and the SnowBall - Wow, we were about to leave and I was actually yelping for a good dessert place and was about to go to Snowball Shavery all the way in C-Town.  I had a guest here from New York, so we were on an excursion of food before her flight back to the Big Apple that night.  We were about to pay and then one of the other waiters asked us about dessert and we said....What the Heck!

The Funkler - A Chocolate chip Blondie with ice cream and chocolate sauce. The size of a huge slice of pie, we devoured it. The blondie was really great tasting and the ice cream and sauce made this a la mode hunk of chocolate chip was definitely plate licking worthy.

The SnowBall - Yep, those good ole Hostess SnowBalls that I had growing up.  Chocolate cake wrapped in a fluffy marshmallow  and coconut and pink!  So much better tasting than the Hostess one.
