This has a more dense texture and heavier cake.  Made for an awesome tasting dessert  Came with some kind of ice cream.  I was not sure what it was exactly.

4.  Service - 3 star at best - In my two times here, I would say that they service was okay.  First time was lunch they kept servicing us from the far side of our table, over all the condiments and so far away from us.  Very odd.  Second time, we had dinner and it took about 10 minutes for the waiter to come take our drink orders, it took about twenty minutes and two reminders to get our drinks, then when we ordered, he left out two orders and got one of the vegetarian ones, entirely wrong and brought it with meat.  We never got the two other orders, but since I checked the bill and they did not charge me, we didn't ask for them. It was too late and we had a plane to catch.  A good point is that another waiter came out and corrected the vegetarian order and gave us a take home box for the meat order and did not charge us. That was cool.

You are only as strong as your weakest link so I feel that once they get their wait staff fully up to speed, this place will be a solid 4 or 5. On a good note, we had one main server, and three others helping him so I love teamwork!
I came with a friend to check this new place.  Food is average at best.  The old sushi restaurant is way better.  Wont be coming back

First time for dinner. Nice atmosphere. looking for music that they said would be playing for Valentines, may be we misunderstood. We ordered two rolls and thai steak salad. Was impressed with the steak- tender and dressing was flavorful. The rolls were called Las Vegas and Hawaiian, both were good. We somehow got a complimentary roll too. Dessert was also free, because we made reservations for Valentines. Good to see sushi chefs were actually asian. Would like to try their other items, interesting menu. The waitress was friendly and attentive. Nice place to go for a date. Will go back at lunch to try the other rolls and ramen.

Small portions. Expensive. Limited menu. Not a single thing for kids/teens to eat. $4 for a kids orange juice. Staff wasn't very friendly. $100 tab and we left hungry.
NOT FAMILY OR KID FRIENDLY.
We won't be back...

Do you notice how much sake they want to give away for free? Probably because they want you to get drunk so you don't notice how shitty it is here!

Got to the restaurant for happy hour on a Saturday. The sushi chef had no idea what he was doing. We ordered the cucumber salad and he gave us something that had missing ingredients from what the menu said! Basically trying to gyp us. We asked him about it and instead of starting over he grabbed our plate and dumped what he gave us back into the container where it came from! Ew!

To add to that, the sushi bar isn't even packed with fish showing that they probably don't sell a lot of sushi because it's probably not that good. And the menu isn't even impressive. We were expecting this awesome fusion restaurant and we left happy knowing we didn't get ripped off paying a ton of money for food the guy can't even make.

Had to give a shout out to my favorite happy hour to visit when I'm in town! I stopped in yesterday with a girlfriend for happy hour and as always, Lucky Foo's did not disappoint. The food is always great and I honestly just take the recommendations of the staff. I still have yet to regret that. While I've had phenomenal interactions with all of the Lucky Foo's team,  I will shamelessly admit that Miguel is my favorite! I think it's important to note that the atmosphere is laid back and open-- often mistaken for poor service or lack of care-- but it isn't! What makes Lucky Foo's great (at least for me and my friends that go) is that they take the time to treat you like a person. You know, like have a quick chat or joke. People need to remember that they are interacting with humans and not robots. So with that, you get what you give, and I've always had (and will continue to have) a great experience. But don't take my word for it, check it out for yourself! I'll be back the next time I'm in town!

Last review I left was based on the rude hostess. But it's been a while since then, so I decided to give this place another try. Actually the sister in law wanted to try it, so that's why I went. Well the hostess, and the server were great!! But the food is not good at all. The menu for lunch is very limited and very boring. Considering the decor in the place, which is very nice and creative, you would think the menu would match. But that's not the case. The food has no flavor. And the quality is bad for the price they charge. I should have just stuck with what I said in my previous review, and not have come back here.
A great find for fresh and creative food options, excellent service, awesome ambiance and great drink choices. Just go!!!

If you read my other reviews you'll note they are all long winded.  Not this one.

Only made up words can describe this place.  Like Wonderfoo, Foobulous, and Footastic.  Nothing sucks.  Nothing is Awefoo.  Serious.

We did brunch on Sunday.  The endless mimosa is a great idea and good price for $18.  My wife had to drive us home.

Katsu chicken and waffles.  A good idea?  No, a great idea.  Crazy good.  Awefooly Footastic.

Hey, here's an idea.... let's have fire roasted Brussel sprouts for breakfast.  I typically hate them and will have something nasty to say about Foo's when I get home.  Nope.  They were out of this world off da hook Foobulous.

This place has like a million 5 star reviews so if you really want good, serious information, that will help you decide if you want to eat here, skip this review and read the others.  I'm still pretty well pickled up from the gallon of mimosa I drank.  Did I mention the wife had to drive us home?

Enjoy!  I'm going to take a nap.

This place is delicious!!! We had the sweetest waitress helping us too. Her name is Kelly. She was very friendly and she explained items on the menu and had some delicious recommendations! She also kept checking up on us to make sure we were doing ok. We live in this area so we were looking for a place close by to have a late night dinner and this place is perfect!! The sushi was delicious (lemon roll is heaven, and the skewers are to die for) and the service was awesome! The drinks were really good as well! This is definitely going to be a regular for us!

I was one lucky ones to get to attend opening. They did an excellent job. 
Refreshing to leave the strip and find Elegance, beautiful ambiance, delicious food and great staff... Class all the way, if you get a chance to go, you will not be disappointed must check it out, it was amazing!

My husband I went for lunch.  There were not many people in there and it took 15 min before the manager finally came over and asked if anyone had helped us yet.  When we said no he sent someone over to take our drink order.  Then it was another 10 min wait before they took our food order.  We just ordered a 3 rolls and that took 30 min and nobody ever came over to check on us. Then there was MORE waiting for the bill...in total we were there about 1 1/2 for 3 sushi rolls.  

The food was good too bad the service was terrible.

I followed the sky lights to Lucky Foo's last Friday.  Turns out it was their opening night and celebration. The food is not only delicious but it is beautiful to look at. ..true food art. They have an AWEsome assortment of sake including some house infused flavors.  We enjoyed everything about this place! The atmosphere is fresh and the staff is warm and welcoming.

This restaurant is such an incredible experience! Every time I come in I receive immaculate service. Great drinks, awesome food, and incredible desserts! You can also control the music which I think is really cool. Five stars!
Had a surprise birthday party here on Sunday and they did a fantastic job!! There was about 40 people and the food was delicious and the service was fantastic!!

Amazing and super friendly service. The waiters were extremely helpful and informative. They answered every question about the menu and guided my party and I in the right direction! The food was great too and had a super fun environment. 

Can't wait to go back!

Last night at Lucky Foo's was amazing! Excellent food, service, and ambiance. We threw a birthday party for my wife and had about 40 guests. The Lucky Foo's team setup a separate area for our group and did a combination of passed food and buffet style. We had a huge variety of dishes, including sushi, ebiyaki, yakisoba, yakitori skewers (pork belly AND bacon wrapped shrimp!), lucky rice, and more. People were raving about how great the food was! I looked like a hero. :) Sushi was:
Secret Weapon
Yum Yum Scallop
Caterpillar 
Spicy Tuna and
Las Vegas 
The staff was super friendly and accommodating. The DJ was on point with the music mix and vibe. Thanks DJ Presto One!
Go to Lucky Foo's ASAP! It's the bomb!
Service.... Maybe o k.... No ac and a lot of their items posted on yelp were not available... Not going again... Sorry lucky foos.   U were not lucky 4 me!

This will be my new  fav sushi with a twist place .Nom noms for sure! nice ambiance, great food and good service. I would recommend reservation because it can be a hit and miss on the place being crowded or not. Just to be sure call in to reserve so you don't have to wait. After you eat here you'll be coming back and mark this as one of your local hang out place for chow and drink and ...........that makes you a LUCKY FOO! :) I will come back

Decent food and awesome service. We were doing vegetarian month when we ate here,  so we were limited on our choices. The Stella chips were great. We got some noodles and a veggie roll that were good but not great. We will definitely try again when we can choose from the whole menu

Sorry to say but just horrible. Had the won ton chip n dips and they were greasy. Ask the waiter if the roll  I wanted really had real crab or fake krab ... She assured me it was real but guess what?! Krab ... Ick! The Thai beef salad was lackluster ... the greens soggy, the beef without flavor and chunky chewy slices ... So disappointed all around!

A couple weeks ago I stopped by Lucky Foos and sat at the bar, had one drink with my wife and we both thought the vibe was really, really cool (don't believe me? Look at the photos:)) ... so, I returned today to try their food for lunch. 

I had another great experience....

I was pleasantly greeted at the door and seated in a comfy booth. The atmosphere is unbelievable. They spent some money on the decor, love it! They play cool music too. Had me tapping my chopsticks the entire time. Ha! 

The waitress was very nice, she had a few recommendations, "the lemon roll"... Which I ended up getting along with the foo burger. Yum! I was served a complimentary (two pieces) of blue fin tuna, which I thought was a cool touch to the experience. The lemon roll was EXCELLENT! The Foo Burger and fries did not disappoint. 

Since I work around the corner, and they are open for lunch now, I will be visiting probably once a week. The Ramen is next for me. Yummy!!

What really stood out here was the service- waitress was super attentive, hosted greeted with smile and overall everyone was really nice. Refills would happen immediately. And empty plates would get removed lightening fast. Food was good nothing too memorable but it didn't disappoint at all. Menu is somewhat innovative but it lacks execution. Prices are moderate, this place will not set you back at all. If you tired of overpriced, overhyped and underwhelming food on the strip , than defiantly visit this place. Perfect way to start off your night on the town.

I really liked this place.
I've never seen it busy, and it looks like they spent a ton of money getting open, so I do hope that they succeed.
The sushi was quite good, as were the ramen dishes. I've been twice, and sat outside both times, it was a nice little "chill" patio.
Service was great, I really have no complaints at all.
The sea salt hand-scrub in the restroom is a MUST TRY:)

So excited for this restaurant in the area!  Had the Ebiyaki, pork belly steamed buns, jalape√±o yellowtail and the Lucky rice - everything was delicious.  Try the saki infusion if you like cold saki.  I definitely want to come back to try some of the sushi rolls.

This place has decent ambiance and decor, I liked the music playing, and our server was well put together, friendly, and on top of things. So why the two stars? The food is where this place falls flat on its face. 

We went in on a Monday night. There was one other couple seated at a table and a few people at the bar. Other than that, it was a bunch of staff mulling around with nothing to do. Ghost town.

I was starving and ready to hop all over the menu. We got the Warm Root Salad (which wasn't bad, but also wasn't warm), two miso bowls which were just average, and two sushi rolls which were just plain not good. On one roll the rice was very compacted and dry, to the point where it was almost inedible without adding soy sauce, yet somehow the second roll was soggy and mushy. My lady companion is from Hawaii and knows her sushi. She said it tasted like the rolls sat in the fridge all night and then they just topped them with fresh fish, which I have to concur. The mushrooms in our miso bowls were clearly dried and then rehydrated. The quality of ingredients was just underwhelming. 

Also, I ordered a Moscow Mule, which didn't taste bad, but it also didn't taste like it had a drop of alcohol in it. I wasn't going to say anything, but when my server asked how the Mule was, I answered honestly, "It tastes a little weak..." Her response was, "Oh...I'll have to let the bartender know." But that was it. No offer to remake it, comp it, or anything. $10 for a weak drink is kind of lame. 

Our bill was about $60 and I still left a nice tip because our server was nice, but I see no reason to return here. I was still kind of hungry when I left and would have ordered more if the food were better. Maybe it was an off night, but with no customers and very mediocre food, I don't see where all of these great reviews are coming from or how they'll be able to keep their doors open.
If I could give negative stars I would. There was a HAIR in my friends sushi roll. The sushi was not worth the 14 dollars. Not to mention the extremely poor service and horrible management their.
Having the best brunch here today. NEW brunch theme is great and best CHICKEN/WAFFLES in vegas. Love this place!

Meh.  Nothing to special, except for the sushi roll we had.  Topped with Mango, super fresh.   the hostesses are lacking, Never greeted us and we stood there with all of them walking past us for 10 minutes. Mind you, there was only 2 other diners there on  Saturday 530.  we tried the ramen, not good.  noodles were still hard.    the potato crusted corn dog was oily, and the sausage was subpar, as a house special I would have expected more.  Bacon wrapped shrimp was good.  the star was the sushi roll we had, it was light and fresh.

Came because Jeremy Espinosa was the DJ, and quickly found out the food, and drink are fantastic.

We started with the the short rib, and the shrimp tacos. They were great! 

Next, we had these nachos with wonton chips. They were even better

Finally, I had 3 different drinks. Each one was better then the last. 

Overall I had a great experience here, and will be back
Wow!!!! Very very good!! Exciting flavored and fresh sushi we found it by accident and were very pleased:) the lucky rice with egg on top was delicious as well as the surf and turf.

Fantastic Asian fusion cuisine In Henderson ! music ,ambience & the food is really tasty. 
Upper scale contemporary lounge feel. dim light ,sexy ,sultry music 
*vegetarian & chicken lettuce wraps both yum ; however, I preferred the chicken. 

* edamame w/ a sweet & spicy sauce 
* maitake mushroom skewers
* wonton chips - anything fried taste delicious but, these are seasoned to perfection. 
* avocado rolls, tasty too.

This place is fantastic!  I highly recommend it & definitely a new favorite.

The service was great and the food was very good.  I had the chicken and rice bowl and it was different than anyone I have had before.  There was great flavor and spices that weren't masked by a bunch sauce.  For desert, we had the large fortune cookie that is on a scoop of gelato.  That was pretty good and mixed well with the gelato and fruit sauces on the side.  I recommend this place!  Great atmosphere, good service and good food!

I've been here a few times to meet friends for lunch or dinner. Lucky Foos offers Asian fusion eats along with traditional dishes and sushi options. The food tastes delicious and we were very impressed with the appetizer selection. My favorites were the 'nachos' made from won tons and also the shrimp balls. 

My only drawback is the pricing per portion for meals. We had a large group at one point and it was quite the bill adding up drinks and apps and the one entree my husband and I had. 

If you're looking for a little more upscale Asian to dine off of the 215 and Eastern, this is a good place.

This place is great. Awesome drinks and a fun atmosphere. We went on a slow night, but it was still great. There were a couple of issues with the waitstaff, but nothing too bad. The bus boy cleared our table, drinks and all when he thought we were finished.  Turns out we had just both stepped away for a moment.  The server replaced the drinks and all was well.  I think they are ironing out the wrinkles, and once they do, I'll give them a 5-star review.

First time here tonight with friends and it was a good experience. For sushi rolls had the Mariachi Samurai, Lemon Roll & Secret Weapon. All 3 worth trying! The miso soup was good but maybe chunks of Tofu were too big. Bigger than any I've seen before in miso. For a starter the Stellar Chips were really good. Manager was really friendly. Turns out we had some friends in common. No complaints really. I will be back again.

What an interesting place, so much potential, with a few tweaks then it could be great.

Chicken wings, good, not great.

Yakisoba with chicken, good again, not great.

The Best Chicken Sandwich....Okay, little story, we were out last night with a couple of friends who happen to read my posts, the one thing they said is, at times my reviews come across as "angry"...I can see that, this is one of those dishes....If you are going to name something on your menu 'The Best *******" then it had better be the best, or at least very good, this was neither, the chicken patty was way to small for the bun, the panko crust was way to thick for the patty and then cooked to much making it hard instead of crunchy.

I said similar things about the chicken sandwich at culinary dropout, but as a test, I just stopped at McDonald's and picked up a buttermilk chicken sandwich, I have to say, McDonald's makes a better chicken sandwich than Lucky Foo's or Culinary Dropout, for 1/3 the price.

Anyways, service was good, attentive but not overbearing, even with the negative things I have said, I would still go back, if only to try the burger which I have heard is excellent from friends.
Food, decor, service, ambience was perfect! Everything I ordered was good! The resting panda cocktail was light & refreshing. Great quality food & presentation! Definitely coming back for more!
Cool restaurant design, creative dishes, hipster atmosphere, comfortable patio area, groovy music and the service has improved: I increase my rating to 5 stars!
NIce place,..food and service was good. The variety show they had when we were there was fantastic.  Wish we knew about it in advance.

Service was the worst , Cinco de Mayo they took care of our bill which was nice that wasn't what we wanted . Owner apologized and said it was very unusual , it was my first time so wasn't impressed , but it was taken care of immediately .

Awesome omelette !!!!!
The Kimi omelette is full of flavor .
Served with a perfectly grilled tomato , with pesto sauce .  Great service and attention to detail . The food is hip and chic .
Also , the sashimi is top notch !!!

Best burger I had in a long time.  I've been here a few times and it's true that sometimes there is a mixup with orders or something, but they are fairly new and still getting their footing.  Most importantly, all you have to do is let them know and they will go above and beyond to fix it.  Service has always been very polite.

Good food, great ambiance, good location. Visited this place 4/1/15 around 7pm. Went on a Travel zoo voucher and the staff didn't give us any trouble with using the voucher.Restaurant wasn't busy at all. Waiter was very attentive and the food came out remarkably fast.

The food:
-Starter: Foo platter. It was ok. Pretty standard wings, egg rolls, dumplings and chips. I will say the egg rolls were AMAZING! 

-Drinks: I had the Crouching Tiger which was pretty good. Must be a whiskey fan to enjoy this drink. My friend had the Rising Sun (I think) it was really good. Very light and slightly fruity.

-Short rib ramen: was pretty good. The broth is the star on this one. If you're a ramen fan I recommend giving this a try.

-Pork belly ramen: From what my friend said, this was pretty good as well

Overall I recommend this place to check out if you're in the area. It seems like a great place to go for a happy hour hang out as there's a really nice patio area and delicious drinks.

Great food - rolls are larger than at most places, and I felt prices very reasonable.  We only had rolls, so can't speak to the rest of the menu.  One slight disappoinment, we had a vegatarian with us, she ordered two menu items - both they did not have.

Otherwise service was great, and very attentive.  Atmosphere also very nice, with a patio as well.

Family and I made reservations for dinner. This was my second time here. I love the ambience. Music was great! For appetizers, I highly recommend the edamame! The sauce that comes with it is pretty darn good. Foo Dogs were to bark for! (woof!)  For main courses we ordered mostly sushi. I love how they served a lot of wasabi and ginger! The lasagna roll was bomb and so was the shrimp tempura roll! We also ordered the Short Rib Ramen. It was extremely salty and had a certain taste that my palette did not enjoy at all. Miso soup was also too salty.  Overall, it's ok. Thank you to the manager on duty for being very accommodating.

Sunday brunch - with a reservation for 7. There was another large party that arrived at opening with a reservation as well. We kept being told about a "large birthday party" the night before as the reason for nothing going right. While the food was GREAT, our cocktails took over 20 minutes, more than 3 requests to get lemons for waters that never got refilled, our appetizers arrived after the entrees, and everything was slow. We greatly enjoyed the food, but won't be back.

This place was just okay in my opinion. Our table for 3 ordered the charred shishito peppers, foo fogs, chicken wings, lucky rice with short rib, ramen with short rib, crispy rice sushi, and the jalapeno yellowtail. We also had Waterdragon cocktail, Geisha Girl, and a hot sake. The food was mediocre and waaayy overpriced for what it was. The peppers and yellowtail where the best items we tried and were actually pretty tasty. I had to down several glasses of water with my ramen because the broth was straight up salt... the short rib part though was well cooked and flavorful. Cocktails were delicious, it would probably be the only ever thing I would have it I went back there. Decor and ambiance is awesome and nice, there is outdoor seating that would be good on a day with nice weather. However, I do not think I would go back here again because the price you pay for what you get is not worth it. Even though my food experience wasn't that great, I must say that they were very tentative with service. Maybe because it was a Friday night...but hardly any other tables there, but it was still appreciated.

Went on a Wednesday night, 5pm for Happy Hour. 

Items Selected:
Salmon Avocado sushi roll
Lasagna sushi roll
Yakitori Pork Belly skewers 
Tangy Korean Buffalo Chicken Wings
Short Rib Ramen

This place has caught my eye several times, and after checking out a few reviews and the menu, I had to give it a try. So many items sounded delicious.
My friend and I came here on Weds Happy Hour. It wasn't busy, maybe 4 tables total. Perfect! We should get quick service and good food.....keyword: should.

The hostess brought us menus and water, and we looked over the menu and made our decisions in 3-4 minutes. At least 15 minutes went by before we had to flag the hostess down and get someone to take our order. I believe I counted 3 servers and a manager guy walk by at least 3 times. A guy seated after us actually put his order in first. Lets just say...not well organized...so glad it wasn't packed full of customers. 

Free infused sake if you check in on Yelp.

Yakitori Pork Belly Skewers...2 skewers with 3 smallish pork bellies on each. Lacked flavor, and a bit too fatty. 3/5
Tangy Chicken Wings - Good flavor, nice kick with the buffalo sauce. 4/5
Short Rib Ramen - Heavy miso flavored broth. Noodles a bit undercooked and chewy. Short rib had a nice grilled flavor to it and tender. Could have used something to bring it up a notch. 3/5

The sushi rolls are good...the only bad part was it took well over 20 minutes to get them. Not sure how long it takes to make a roll but it definitely doesn't take that long. Lasagna roll was unique from other Japanese lasagna rolls in that it didn't seem baked and each piece was decorated individually and not as a group. I liked it. 4/5

To sum it all up.....OK food, slow service, and really nothing that wow'd me to make me want to come back. Which is too bad because I like the variety of offerings...from sushi to Ramen and more. I'll probably give them one more try because I want the pork belly ramen. If you aren't packed during Happy Hour, there's probably a reason for that. Maybe Tacos and Tequila Tuesdays was busier.

Great Environment and amazing food!  What a great neighborhood local hang out.  The place is set up for fun and for a quiet date night.  They have a great bar area and an area with couches and lounge like seating, they also have a large patio area, and  a nice dining area.  They have a cool digital jukebox type system that allows you to select the music that will play straight from your smartphone, people in the restaurant get to vote on your selections from their smartphones, kind of cool.  

I typically drink a straight vodka drink to stay away from the sugar.  But that night the bartender had me try a few things, usually I say no, this day I didn't and what a surprise.  They had a house made mango infused sake that was awesome, I had a taste of two house specialty drinks that were also amazing, but my surprise was the sake on tap, it was cold, clean and crisp, with a light carbonation to it making it more like a champagne, really nice!

The food was amazing.  I went in for sushi, which was really great and they do have some house specialty rolls, that looked and sounded amazing, but I would up having their take on Hawaiian poke', which is nothing like any poke' I had before, I don't even know how to explain what was on it, but the flavor was great!  I then had the cedar plank salmon which was not  even on the menu yet, they told me it was a newly introduced item that would hit the menus next week.  WOW!  The salmon quality was amazing, it was cooked to perfection, with a nicely crisp outside, but still soft tender and moist inside, it had a cedar and believe it or not a bacon like flavor to it.  YUM!  It was served with some greens and over an awesome risotto with crispy prosciutto? or bacon? or pork?  or ?? in it, I don't know what but the flavor combinations were great!

I will be back, and I'm really hoping that this place becomes the go to spot in the area, it has all the potential to do so, great food, great environment, fun social spot!

I feel Lucky that I found Lucky Foo's!

The first thing you really care about when dining out is the food, atmosphere and service. Lucky Foo offers all this and more courteous staff and Miguel was absolutely the very best. Check it out for youself and ask for Miguel

Incredible drinks and amazing food at an affordable price. Great service, especially the head mixologist, Landon.  The Water Dragon is a must try, it's extraordinary!  & the Crouching Tiger is perfection!

I was there a couple month ago ...
Nice place  good food ..... 
My first time in that kind of food place I was along the was no else on the restaurant and the bartender seen like we did not want to explain simplest questions. ... like I said I only had sushi once .... a free sample at Sam's club lol
I like it and I decide to to to a new nice place ..with a grupon. ..
I just thought  he could be more legit ...
I'll understand if it was  rush hour .... 
But I was the only costumer in the whole  place...
I did make a big mistake in asking if I could charge you phone.
He replay 
"do you want me to wash your car too?"
I toke as a joke but I did NOT lough! 
Good food nice ambience now I know a bit  more  I may return.

Second time here , sushi is still good ! But I got really confused with the happy hour menu, it printed all food is $7 then right next to it is regular menu, I don't mind to pay for regular , but I felt like I got tricked by it ! Make me feel like a fool!!! And also just because it's happy hour , I don't think the stuff can handle the busy hours ! We ordered the cocktails didn't come after we almost finished our dinner , the foo foo platter wasn't good! I'm very disappointed this time I came , just saying!!!

This is my first time to lucky foo and as an avid foodie and after seeing them on Instagram I wanted to give them try. 

From walking in it looks like a cool place, modern seating updated fixtures and a chill atmosphere. 

We were allowed to seat ourselves which was fine and wasn't really a problem. The problem was the lack of attention and service that we received. It took at least 10 minutes till someone asked if we had drink orders in yet. And overall all the servers seem uninterested in helping. Working in hospitality I think I just had a higher standard especially for a nice place like this. 
When you had as little customers as they had only 5-6 other tables is when servers should be trying to take extra care of their customers not check on them every 15 minutes 

I think that if they just went over their manners it would go a long way. A simple please, thank you and your welcome goes a long way. The only server who actually responded to my thank you with a your welcome instead of a k was "James" also the only server to introduce himself 


The food is pretty good the miso ramen was the best I would recommend it! The portions are alittle small side 

Overall I think that this negative experience  would make me not come back, but I think everyone has off days but overall when you work in the service industry regardless of how you feel you gotta suck it up and put your customers first. Something management should really focus on. 

I'll be trying it again in a few months hopefully it'll be better next time

Amazing! Everything I had was delicious. Had the Short Rib Ramen, which was great. Beef & Onion dish, so friggin good.  And one my favorite dishes there was the Pork Belly, indescribable how good it is.  Ended the dish with a Snowball Dessert, which was fantastic.  Everyone is super friendly and the atmosphere is fun & casual.  Definitely one of my new favorite places in town!!

Nice vibe.  Not my favorite food. There was something about the mixture of seasoning that wasn't for me. I like the fusion idea, but you need to be careful with that. Like the Korean fried rice didn't have much of a kimche flavor and had a taste of some Japanese seasoning that doesn't mix well for me. Same goes for the spring rolls.  It used the thin Filipino lumpia style wrap with a filling that had a shitake taste to it with lettuce and cilantro. Trying too hard to put too many cultures in one.   Sometimes you shouldn't mess with a good thing. 

Just realized that the majority of reviews were non Asians who love this place. So I'm just going to have to say it, this is an Asian food place for the non Asian palate. 

For the Asian palate, try these places, Monta, Raku, Goyamon, Thelma's Filipino food, Ichiza, Curry Zen, Pin kao, Zenshin, Bachi Burger, and this is just off the top of my head. With places like these in town, how does Lucky Foo have such a high rating?

omg love this place brought my vegetarian employee and there were plenty of options for her. our waitress kelly is great she is vegan and great service from the staff.. had a conversation with the general manager matt he was polite and nice!! 

cant wait to bring my business partner here

Myself and 2 friends had an amazing experience at lucky foos. The atmosphere was elegant,  energetic and the food was outstanding!  We didn't know what to expect, since none of us have ever been there before but our server candice pointed us in all the right directions with what to choose.  All of her food suggestions were so tasteful and the suggested cocktails were paired so well with each dish. We will definitely return soon! Thank you foos!
Lucky Foos has amazing food and the service was superior. I would recommend going for their happy hour so you can try many items.

Shit shit shit...worst service ever.  Losers. Food?  Average. I've been to this shit stop too many times. Same thing over and over. They cannot get it right. Why do I go back?  I get invited.   Hate it.

I have been dying to try this place out, but sadly I didn't...and probably never will. Reason being, sorry ass customer service!! I won't stop there though, so let me elaborate. We walked in and immediately made eye contact with the bartender, who said nothing. We continued to stand at the hostess counter for another 5 minutes, as we skimmed through a menu without any recognition whatsoever. All while 3 female servers moseyed about the empty restaurant; one refilling water on the sole occupied table, one clearing off dishes from a previously occupied table (that was empty when we arrived), and another walked up and down the hallway with her empty tray. Let's get back to the bartender though who continuously made eye contact with me...more than a handful of times, yet said nothing at all. Yeah you, guy with the tattoo on your neck...your customer service skills suck!!! Sadly the empty martini glasses you moved about from one side of the bar to another were clearly more important than attending to two very hungry customers that were anxious to give Lucky Foo's a shot!! Oh well, off to Tokyo Boys where customer service and food is always at it's finest!!
